Consumer complaint narrative: My loan was refinanced and paid off with PNC Bank in XXXX. They did not properly release the electronic lien to the State Of  Florida so that I could update to my new lender. When I found out I was defaulting on my loan with my finance company due to this, I immediately called PNC Bank. This was on XX/XX/XXXX. They said there was an error on their end and it would be fixed within a week. It is now XX/XX/XXXX and the error is still not fixed and I am defaulting on my new loan.

IDA should be ashamed of their predatory collections and business practices during this state of emergency involving COVID-19 global pandemic. Though I've made ALL payments on time, IDA would not work with me on payment arrangements since my paycheck was significantly short this month. They should not be allowed to prey on the working poor, and they must provide hardship programs during this pandemic. Today, it was made obvious to me THEY CARE NOTHING ABOUT THEIR CUSTOMERS WHO KEEP THEM IN BUSINESS BY PAYING OUTRAGEOUSLY HIGH INTEREST RATES. 

I contacted them via email on XX/XX/XXXX stating : " Hello. As this COVID-19 crisis has hit us, I've not been at work for several weeks now and will tentatively return to work on XX/XX/XXXX. I just got paid and was disgustingly shocked at how much was taken out of my check in addition to not being paid for the " extra '' like after school tutoring ( I turned in my timesheet so not sure why that wasn't on my paycheck ). The amount is significantly lower to really limit me in paying all of my bills, including my car payment. I've attached XXXX 's, XXXX 's, XXXX 's, and XXXX 's paychecks for documentation of the drastic difference in pay. Being my bank account was already overdrawn and had already gone over my overdraft privilege of - {$500.00}, this significant decrease in pay has seriously hurt my family in such desperate times. 

I'm letting you all know in writing so we can work together to come up with a solution .... possible deference until I receive our stimulus check of roughly {$3400.00} ... .partial payment until I get paid again and can caught up on the past due balance. After rent, water, lights, and car insurance, I have {$300.00} left and haven't bought enough groceries and supplies to get us through this quarantine. It's my greatest hope we can work together on a solution to get my account paid up as soon as possible. Thank you! '' I received a threatening text from one of IDA 's reps today stating, " Payment is past due. Vehicle will be repossessed and/or disabled if payment isn't made. Broken payment arrangement on XX/XX/20. Please contact IDA immediately. '' Well, I'd already emailed them to document in writing and providing documentation ( my last four paycheck stubs indicating this month 's drastic difference in my pay ). I also called today to explain what's going on but had to leave a message. A rude rep returned my call and cut me off before I could even explain what was going on and how it's affecting my family. She said she received my email and that they don't do hardship programs. I offered to make one weekly payment of {$140.00}, and she refused my offer. My loan was sold to IDA in XXXX, GA by XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX in XXXX, GA without my knowledge until after the fact. IDA is charging outrageous interest rates. {$140.00} weekly for a XXXX XXXX XXXX with XXXX miles on it is ludicrous. However, with my husband going through XXXX XXXX   XXXX XXXX within 3 months time back in XXXX, our credit has suffered as a result of him being on XXXX now, and we were forced to purchase a vehicle from a shady used car dealership. They prey on the working poor, and it's shameful. 

Since my loan was purchased by IDA, I've only received two receipts so I never know how much I'm paying down on my debt. You can only pay online if your account is current. They keep telling me I'm past due {$600.00}, but I began making payments with them as soon as I received paperwork from them in the mail. Their business practices are unethical and highly questionable. Their customer service reps also need to be trained in how to deal with their customers in a nice, sympathetic, and professional manner. 

During this COVID-19 pandemic, auto loan companies like IDA should not be sending threatening texts when families are already under a high level of stress. They should not be allowed to use predatory collection measures during a state of emergency. These people have no moral compass whatsoever. I email Mr. XXXX, the owner, personally forwarding the email I'd sent to their general email address. I have not received a response just as I did not receive a response from the customer service rep though she admitted to reading it. She had the time to send a nasty text, however. This company needs to be stopped immediately before other families such as mine are hurt too.

To the owner of IDA, I also added in my email : " A customer service rep of yours was very unsympathetic to my family 's situation this morning and was borderline rude to me and then to my husband when he called back after I was in tears after getting off the phone with her. See emails and documentation of my significant decrease in pay this month attached below. I have XXXX sons at home during this quarantine. Thanks to IDA, I have been forced into making my full car payment instead of seeing my children get what they need during this pandemic. I thought surely someone at IDA would have a heart and offer some kind of help, but I was sorely wrong. I urge you, sir, to provide customers some type of financial relief during this COVID-19 pandemic. I understand your business is open to make profits, but considering the high interest rates charged I feel a temporary deferment plan could be implemented. I have a college student, a high school student, and a XXXX year old with XXXX that are depending on me and to have transportation in order to get supplies while we're in quarantine. I have {$200.00} in my bank account. My husband 's XXXX of a whopping {$720.00} comes in Friday. XXXX  is giving us until Friday to pay {$600.00}. Please advise how we can give most of our money to IDA and feed our family. We can't get govt. assistance, churches are handing out very little food, and we do not have any family support system. When we make this payment on Friday, just know my children will be doing without due to IDA 's unethical, predatory business practices. If any solution can be made, I'm more than willing to work with you all. I've made my payments faithfully since my loan was sold to IDA. I've received two receipts the entire time I've been a customer and both were from XXXX XXXX who was always very nice. The other reps really need training in customer service. Please help me with a solution in order to best provide for my family. '' It is my greatest hope the owners and employees of Independent Dealer Advantage LLC will correct their methods and business practices, especially when it comes to collections. This really should be illegal during a national crisis.

I never been late on a payment and always paid ahead.

Sub-issue: Lender trying to repossess or disable the vehicle
Consumer complaint narrative:
We have had a loan on our vehicle, opened to finance the purchase of the vehicle, issued and held by XXXX Bank since XXXX, account number XXXX. In the last 3 years, our vehicle has been repossessed 3 times for payments that were less than 90 days past due, which is contrary to the terms of our loan agreement. We have established in prior communications with XXXX bank that our contract states that repossessions will only occur after an account is 90 days past due, but that they process repossessions after accounts fall 60 days past due regardless of these terms. 

We have made numerous attempts to resolve this issue with the company via phone, from discussing the circumstances under which the vehicle has been repossessed, requesting a full payment history of the account, asking for payment arrangements after repossession regardless of the impropriety of the bank 's action and requesting support setting up automated payments to avoid late payments in future. We have been advised by the company that their practices do not align with the terms of our contract ( above ), that automated payments can only be set up by using paper forms submitted through the mail, and that they will not make any arrangements for payment after repossession regardless of circumstance excepting holding the vehicle for up to 10 days prior to sale. Each time this situation has occurred, we have paid the requested amount in full in order to have the vehicle released, as we need the vehicle to transport ourselves to work and our children to school. 

The first repossession was removed from our credit reporting. While XXXX has subsequently refused to acknowledge any action taken on our reporting, we assume this was removed due to the bank 's practice of repossessing vehicles prior accounts falling 90 days past due, as described above. The last repossession still appears on our credit reporting despite this same practice leading to repossession. XXXX bank is also not providing us with paper or electronic statements for this account, which makes it impossible for us to review and understand our balance or the amount they claim is due. 

As you can see from the attached images, we have not been provided any notice of these amounts prior to repossession. When we login to our online payment portal, the only thing that shows is that our last payment was due 71 days ago as of today, which, per the Federal Consumer Credit Reporting Act, does not, in fact, constitute 90 days past due. The account information screen does not provide a total amount due, only the amount of the individual payment for each month, as well as the last due date for which payment is due. We also have elected for electronic statement delivery on this account ( see attached photo ), which we've had set up on this account since it was first opened. When we attempted after the call this morning to verify the amount due, we discovered that we have never been issued, nor can we retrieve, any statements for or notices about this account whatsoever. 

At this time, the bank is requiring payment well in excess of the amount that should actually due on the account before releasing the vehicle, based on the information available to us as account holders through our online portal. We have received nothing in the mail from XXXX bank regarding the status of this account, nor have any statements or notices been issued to us online. 

On Saturday, XX/XX/XXXX, around XXXX XXXX  Central time, our vehicle, a blue XXXX XXXX, was repossessed from our home at XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX, TN XXXX. Payment on that date was 69 days past due. 

We were advised by the tow company that they received the repossession order by fax or electronic transmission on Saturday, XX/XX/XXXX, around XXXX XXXX   Central time. Because XXXX closes their call lines at XXXX XXXX. Eastern time on Saturdays, we were unable to contact them to discuss resolution until Monday, XX/XX/XXXX. On XX/XX/XXXX at XXXX XXXX. Central, I was able to contact a representative, XXXX, in their call center using the number XXXX. 

In this recorded call, XXXX confirmed that payment on the vehicle was approximately 70 days past due at the time of repossession, and also confirmed that XXXX " considers '' that to be 90 days past due. She advised me that the total amount due to recover the vehicle from the tow company was {$1800.00}. She confirmed that this figure is composed of the following amounts : {$1300.00} past due balance ; {$70.00} fees ; {$440.00} repossession fee. 

Based on the information provided online, our account payment is set at {$350.00} per month. Payments in this amount for XXXX, XXXX, and XXXX add up to {$1000.00}. It was not stated in our phone conversation what the {$70.00} in fees quoted has been assessed for.

Consumer complaint narrative:
To Whom It May Concern : Thank you for taking the time to read this letter, and I hope your day is going well. Im writing because I noticed that my most recent credit report contains late payments reported on account. 

I want you to know that I understand my financial obligations, and if it werent for hardships, Id have an excellent repayment record. I made a mistake in falling behind, but since then, circumstances have changed, Ive had a spotless record of on-time payments. 

I applied for a home for my family, and its come to my attention that the missed payment on my record hurt my ability to qualify due to the low score. I truly believe that it doesnt reflect my creditworthiness and commitment to repaying my debts. It would help me immensely if you could give me a second chance and make a goodwill adjustment to remove all the late payments. 

Thank you for your consideration, and I hope youll approve my request.

I have never been late on my regular note. I send an extra XXXX a week, by check..to the address Chase stated and written on the check is " principal payment ''. I do this because it adds up to an entire payment going to principal a year. However, Chase continues to post to interest, I have to check each payment, take a screenshot of the posting and call them. They can take over a week to correct the posting but meanwhile I'm being charged interest on the principal total, so I believe basically that my extra principal payments are being eat up in interest because of Chase 's poor posting habits.

I am a US XXXX Veteran with an XXXX service record and XXXX. I purchased a XXXX XXXX XXXX from XXXX with an auto loan from Capitol One Auto Loan on XX/XX/XXXX with a comprehensive/liability policy through XXXX. All payments were made on time as outlined in the contract. In XXXX of XXXX, the car was totaled by a semi truck when the semi swerved impacted the front of my vehicle. I submitted the claim to my insurance company ( subcontracted through XXXX ). XXXX XXXX denied the claim, stating they had canceled my policy due to non-payment. The last payment on the loan was XX/XX/XXXX with a balance due outstanding. 

FACTS : Insurance ( XXXX ) was procured and set up on auto-payments deducted directly from the same ( XXXX ) checking account. XXXX failed to notify me ( user ) of certain changes in 3rd Party insurance providers ( subcontractors ), used old contact information from nearly 5 years prior, and never notified the LOSS PAYEE ( Capitol One Auto Loan ) of the lapse which resulted from a breakdown in communication. XXXX did not notify anyone until the claim for the total loss was filed. 

The loan required the buyer to maintain a comprehensive insurance policy on the vehicle for the life of the loan. At no time was the alleged lack of insurance or alleged lapse of coverage reported, and at no time was I notified by the XXXX or Capitol One Auto Loan of the alleged lapse in insurance coverage. This is in violation of the contract and agreement by the lender. The lender ( Capitol One Auto Loan ) failed to report the lapse. With the lender listed as loss payee on the vehicle, it is the responsibility of the insurance carrier to automatically notify the lender of coverage and any changes therein, as is outlined in the agreement terms of the contract. XXXX failed to notify Capitol One Auto Loan of the lapse, and neither Capitol One Auto Loan nor XXXX notified myself ( user ) of the lapse until after the claim was filed. 

I am not financially capable of paying this loan. I can not afford an attorney and I am considering filing for Chapter XXXX.

Hi- I opened a Citibank Accelerate Savings account # XXXX on XX/XX/XXXX. I initially linked a Checking account to fund the account with {$500.00}. I verified this account with trial deposit information. 

Later on XX/XX/XXXX, I requested to add 3 additional savings account for external transfer ( CIT Bank, XXXX XXXX   and XXXX XXXX XXXX ). On XX/XX/XXXX I verified these accounts via trial deposit for transfer and they were enabled for external transfer. Once the accounts were enabled for transfer I requested a transfer of {$15000.00} from CIT Bank {$150.00} from XXXX XXXX On XX/XX/XXXX Citi Bank attempted call me at XXXX with a potential fraud concern and left me a voice mail and I called them back at XXXX. On this call the representative routed me to the security department and they verified my identity, they confirmed that the both the account with the transfers belonged to me. They informed that they wou d need to verify my account with CIT Bank through a 3 way call with CIT and they would call me back and I should stay near my phone. Before I made the call they went ahead and cancelled my {$15000.00} transfer from CIT Bank and suspended my ability to make interinstitution transfers ( both at XXXX ). The {$15000.00} had been debited from CIT bank on XX/XX/XXXX ( per CIT Bank posted transactions ) by Citibank. 

On XX/XX/XXXX, As I did not receive a call back from Citibank I contacted them again at XXXX. During this call again a rep verified me and passed me on again to the security team, the same story again that they would need to verify my account with CIT bank and they cant do it while on the phone and that they would need to initiate the call. I told them I was unhappy about the fact that my money was debited and they cant tell me how or when they can resolve the problem. They promised to call me back quickly and asked me to keep my phone close to me. I did not receive a call back. I was genuinely worried about the missing {$15000.00} and kept checking my accounts daily to hoping that there was a resolution. 

On XX/XX/XXXX, I saw a pending return transaction for {$15000.00} on CIT bank and then I again contacted Citibank at XXXX to ensure my account was put back in good standing. This time the rep I spoke with was more understanding, but said until the return transaction is confirmed they cant remove the block on my account, but once this return is confirmed that should automatically verify the account. And he expected it to happen the next day. I received an email from Citibank on XX/XX/XXXX at XXXX XXXX   informing me that my inter institution transfer was restored. I immediately initiated a same day transfer out for the {$650.00} in the account to XXXX XXXX XXXX account with the intent of closing the Citi account once the transfer was complete. This was posted to the XXXX account on XX/XX/XXXX. 

Citibank account still continues to show this transaction as in progress when I checked on XXXX. I called Citibank on XXXX to close my account and they put me on hold for 25 minutes while they researched and came back and informed me that my account was on hold and they need to verify my CIT account again. They will be unable to close my account without verifying the CIT bank account. I informed the rep that I did not have a pending transaction with CIT bank and since I am not interested in continuing my relationship with Citibank they don't have to worry about verifying the CIT Bank account for funds transfer. The rep informed the only way i can close the account is by calling next day and verfying the CIT Bank account. 

I am worried that Citibank is going to use this as pretext to reverse the {$650.00} in progress transaction with XXXX XXXX and keep this account perpetually open or keep charging me monthly fees. They also left the {$15000.00} in settlement account instead of crediting my account, putting it on hold while they verified the account and paying me the promised interest. I would like CFPB to help escalate this complaint and close this account. Also I would like Citibank to compensate me for lost interest and time over the past two weeks trying to resolve this entire situation over the past 2 weeks.
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response

On XX/XX/2019 my vehicle was involved in an accident and was a total loss. My insurance company paid out the market value of my vehicle to Regional Acceptance Corporation ( RAC ), an affiliate of BB & T, which financed my vehicle. I also have GAP Coverage through XXXX XXXX which would take care of the remaining balance on the vehicle. I initially sent RAC a Lienholder/Lessor report of total loss on XX/XX/19, that they were to complete and return to XXXX XXXX so they could process and pay out on the claim. They failed to return the form. I placed multiple phone calls to RAC to see what the hold up was from XX/XX/XXXX through XX/XX/XXXX. Nobody was able to give me an answer. I left multiple messages and emails for the claims department, and never received a return call or email. On XX/XX/2019 I received a letter form XXXX XXXX indicating they still had not received the requested information from RAC, and they would close and deny the claim after 30 days from the date on the letter. I again reached out to RAC via email and phone to address the situation, and resubmitted the form again for them to complete. After the threat of non-payment one of the reps sent a priority email to someone in upper management, and they finally filled out and completed the form at the end of XX/XX/XXXX. The last step is RAC notifying XXXX XXXX that the warranty on my car was refunded, which they have yet to do. At this point, XXXX as denied the claim, but indicated that they would re-open and pay the claim once they receive this verification. During this time RAC continued to bill me for the remaining balance and in XX/XX/XXXX reported to the Credit Bureaus that I had not made any payments. I discussed the situation may times with them, indicating that the balance would have been paid and taken care of by XXXX XXXX, but has not been due to their own negligence and lack of timeliness. I simply asked that they put a hold or pause on the account until it is settled. They know I have the GAP coverage and that they will be paid, and any difference I would settle with them. Before this I had no missed payments with RAC. The only reason this has gone on as long as it has, is because they didn't do what they were supposed to on their end. This has been going on sinceXX/XX/XXXX of this year, and its almost XX/XX/XXXX. The process  normally takes less than 30 days. However, their reporting has had a severe and negative effect on my credit score and my ability to obtain financing currently and in the future. I am attaching the correspondence I had with RAC and documentation from XXXX XXXX.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I went in to this XXXX dealership ( XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX ) to checkout a used car I had seen online. As soon as you walk in they take all sorts of information about you. I told them not to do a hard pull on my credit report because if I decided to buy a car, I would go to my bank first to discuss a car loan with them. They told me a lot of people have the same concern and promised and assured me that they will not do a hard pull on my credit report. They said they might do a soft pull just to get an idea. Sure enough I get home, and I have an credit monitoring notification indicating that they did a hard pull on my credit reports ( through a company called CREDCO ) even though I explicitly forbade them to and they agreed. Accordingly, my credit score took a hit. 

They also repeatedly fudged their 'tentative ' financing numbers to trick me into thinking that I would be paying less with them than I actually would, so that I would agree to finance the car with them. When I called them out on it, the salesman sheepishly admitted that yea the numbers don't make sense. I got up and left. They also, with no information whatsoever, lied and told me I would get higher interest rates and pay more if I went to finance elsewhere.

In XX/XX/XXXX, I purchased a travel trailer from XXXX XXXX XXXX  in XXXX, Ohio. The loan for the vehicle was arranged through XXXX XXXX Bank and the installment loan terms were set at 11.25 % for 144 months with the first payment due on XX/XX/XXXX. 

I have cancelled checks, bank statements and receipts that demonstrate that 144 consecutive payments of {$220.00} were made between XX/XX/XXXX and XX/XX/XXXX. All but one was made within the 10-day due date grace period. Due to prior commitments I was unable to make it to the bank before they closed and I was assessed a {$40.00} late fee the payment was made one day late on XX/XX/XXXX and the late fee was paid. The total amount paid over the 12 years was {$32000.00} ( i.e., 144 payments of {$220.00} for a total of {$32000.00} plus the {$40.00} late fee ). 

Not all payments were made on the due date so I anticipated a final balance of around {$50.00} to account for cumulative miscellaneous interest. However, in a letter dated XX/XX/XXXX, Huntington National Bank which took over the loan from XXXX after their merger a claim was made that I sill had an outstanding principal balance of {$480.00} and that I owed a further {$3.00} in interest on that balance. 

Repeat calls to Huntington have failed to resolve the discrepancy in payment history. Agents and supervisors for the bank have claimed that several payments were deferred or missed. On a few occasions, when the representative provided a date for an allegedly missed payment - and I indicated that I had a cancelled check and receipt that proves a payment was made - they simply stated that is not what the system shows. 

Nobody has been willing or able to provide documentation that a request to defer a payment was made or that shows a payment was missed. A statement provided by XXXX for tax purposes on XX/XX/XXXX indicates that the account was current and all payments made and applied. Please note : 1 ) I never received any notices by mail that suggested the loan was not current ; and 2 ) virtually all payments were made in-person at the local branch and I was never advised of an issue with the loan or the repayment schedule. 

It may also be important to note that the XXXX statement ledger from XXXX does not reflect a standard amortization schedule or simple interest formula - an issue that has persisted since the loan was arranged. The loan calculations fees, payment amount, and totals never matched the signed Promissory Note. As an example : their statement indicates that the first payment was dedicated fully to interest with none applied to the principal. When asked about this, I was advised that the system will catch-up something that apparently never happened. The issues with this loan may have been an isolated mistake but if habitual and applied to additional accounts it could be large scale fraud ( i.e., {$1.00} per installment for a single account is a rounding-error for a large company but if applied to millions of accounts with frequency it would be significant ). 

I have been advised that two cases were opened to reverse the deferral or investigate the misapplied payment but there has been no change in status. In fact, the last representative threatened me with additional late fees, interest and collection activity if I did not pay the balance they indicate in-full within the next 2 days. The agent refused to suspend the due date until the issue has been investigated and a proper balance calculated. 

At this point, it is clear that the customer service agents and supervisors representing Huntington National Bank have no interest in investigating let alone resolving - this issue. Attempts to escalate the problem within the company have failed. Unfortunately, it appears as though formal complaints and the threat of legal action may be required to gain proper attention to this problem. 

See attached : 1 ) list of all payments ; 2 ) the original purchase receipt ; and 3 ) the original promissory note.

The Bank never sent written notice that the account was going to be charged off unless payment in full was received before a certain time frame. I was making payments on the late charge. 
Its not marked as a paid charge off on Credit reports. It should have never been a charge off at all. The principal of the loan was paid on time. Late charge was the reason for charge off. Consumer complaint narrative:
In XX/XX/XXXX I purchased a motorcycle. I had my loan financed through a bank called MB Financial. Around sometime in XX/XX/XXXX, they merged with 5/3 bank. I was never informed of this. Today ( XX/XX/2019 ), I checked my credit score and noticed my motorcycle loan with 5/3 was delinquent. 

This was very surprising to me for several reasons. 1 ) I had set up auto-pay using their online tool. 2 ) I had never received a phone call alerting me of the first notice of delinquency. 3 ) I also never received a letter notifying me of delinquency.

I called 5/3 bank and immediately brought my account current. I was told the following information over the phone : - MB Financial and 5/3 bank merged in XXXX - Apparently what I set up was not auto-pay, but some other confusing form of payment, even though I scheduled future payments - The phone number they had listed on my account is a phone number that has never had any association with me. I have no idea whose phone number it was, this would explain why I never received a phone call - I then asked why since they verified they had my personal cell phone on file, they made no attempt to call that number. I was told they need verification from the individual first in order to call regarding delinquency. If this is the case, how and why were they able to call the other phone number with no association to me? 
- I asked why I never received a letter to notify me of delinquency. I was told " I don't know '' - I was then informed my motorcycle is being searched for by a repossession team. 
- I was told to file a complain with the FTC regarding the 80 point hit to my credit score and negative remark on my credit report - I was told because of my calm demeanor, that they would most likely be willing to work with me - I then called back to confirm I could get someone to alert the crediting bureau of the mistake - I was on the phone for 47 minutes being transferred 3 times to different departments - I was told under no circumstances, would an adjustment be made to my credit report on good faith, and that the only way they would be willing to help me out would be to provide them with proof of payments I made to the account during the months it was delinquent. This is obviously impossible, and I never made payments those months because 1 ) I assumed auto pay was working as intended 2 ) I was never notified via phone call or letter that my account was delinquent. 

Overall I can't even describe how upset I am at the way this bank has treated me as a customer. I would like to have my situation resolved and the adjustment made to my credit report due to the way the collections department handled the situation. 

Finally, visiting their online payment / account viewer portal, I see absolutely no notifications that my account is past due / delinquent. No messages, or alerts in the alert section.

Sub-issue: Lender trying to repossess or disable the vehicle
Consumer complaint narrative: Wells Fargo Dealer services had my car repossessed on XXXX XX/XX/19 at XXXX. I woke up to a banging on my door at XXXX regarding my car. I was told I needed to hand over my keys by a large man maybe 3x my size. I asked if he could wait and that i needed to cal Wells Fargo and he said no. He said my car popped up on the registry 30 minutes ago and if they didnt pick it up someone else would. At this point, a few of my neighbors were in the hallway because of the noise. I get my keys to go downstairs to see my car on a tow truck. I live in a small building with 8 apartments and a private garage for the residents of the building so they forced themselves in because no one would have let them in. The guy said they made a lot of noise getting my car out. Before I could hand over the keys, the guy took my car key out of my hands. I asked where the car was going and he said just pay the bank what you owe to find out. They refused to give any paperwork or talk to me further. I filed a complained with the office of president affairs the same day ( XX/XX/19 ) regarding this unlawful possession and they still have yet to follow up. They have said that if the repo company says they didnt do it they will take their word. I sent Wells Fargo pictures of my garage which show it isnt open and the repo company said they were let in by someone which is false. I have spoken to Wells Fargo multiple times a day each day to follow up on this case and there is no resolution at this point. I have made the payments to get my car back and still dont have it because they delayed the processing and the repo company would not offer times for me to pick it up today. I now have to wait till Monday and call same day to pick it up

Consumer complaint narrative:
On XX/XX/XXXX I was having an issue paying my auto-loan online due on XX/XX/XXXX so I was late on the first month because I wanted to pay online and needed to take time out of work to call in and inquire why, I called in and there was a technical issue with account linking, so I paid on the phone and I thought the account link issue was fixed. After PNC debt collector calls me I told them about the issue of paying online, so they transferred me to the online department. They informed me that payment of auto loans is not available via mobile app, only available on the website. The debt collector and the website said that {$760.00} was due but that was a fraudulent amount because that included next month, there is no reason but FRAUDULENT BUSINESS PRACTICE to tell me both on the phone and on the website that NEXT MONTH IS DUE. I actually paid the {$760.00} amount online because this is a new auto-loan and I didn't know the actual amount of the payment and didn't want to under pay or waste more time on the phone with PNC. These banks will charge me $ 35+ if I make a mistake however they make multiple mistakes and there is no recourse. I asked for monetary compensation for the fiasco on XX/XX/XXXX and this is what I received from PNC on XX/XX/XXXX : XX/XX/XXXX Message : Dear XXXX, Thank you for contacting us through the Secured Message Center! 

I am sorry for any difficulty in making those payments. The total due shows for the higher amount because it is accounting for the next months charges. Only {$370.00} is due however, as of XX/XX/XXXX. While we would be unable to provide a monetary compensation, we can provide some help in ensuring payments are made and on time with methods such as auto pay or using the online transfer funds tool to set recurring payments manually. Please reply if you will like some additional information on those options. 

If there are any other questions or concerns, you may contact us using the chat button below, or by phone at XXXX / XXXX. We are available XXXX XXXX to XXXX XXXX EST M-F, and XXXX XXXX   to XXXX XXXX on weekends. Please remember that PNC is also available via XXXX, XXXX and XXXX, XXXX XXXX to XXXX  EST 7 days a week. 

Thank you for choosing PNC Bank! 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX PNC Bank

Consumer complaint narrative:
I recently opened a Citi Bank High Yield Savings account. At the time of opening the account is was disclosed to me that I could transfer funds out of the account 6 times per statement period. ( this was a government rule ) When I finally tried to transfer funds out of this account, I found out that I was limited to a maximum transfer of {$10000.00} per day. And the transfer maximum was also limited to {$10000.00} per week. Therefore, I was only allowed to transfer out {$10000.00} in a week 's time period. 

This transfer policy should have been disclosed to me when I opened my saving account. 
If I would have know this, I would not have opened this account. Citi is more than happy to take my money, but acts entitled to hold onto my money. I feel deceived and I am harmed by this lack of disclosure.

Issue: Problems at the end of the loan or lease
Sub-issue: Unable to receive car title or other problem after the loan is paid off
Consumer complaint narrative: At the end of 2018 I got into an accident and it was deemed a total loss. prior to the checks being sent over to the finance company from the insurance company I fail to receive a copy of the payoff balance sheet for the total payoff amount. Because the contract was only in duration for six months the total pay off the balance should not have included the entire finance charge for the duration of the entire contract and should have. At a much lower balance than what was stated to the insurance company. I have called numerous times always to be placed on hold for extended periods of time only to be not held that the end. I have written a letter to your place of business requesting copies of every single document that they have in their files in regards to my account and I received nothing as a response to but an e-mail requesting that I could sign in online to view my account history but when I do so the history in after dating question and not for the entire duration of the contract. And to add to that what they did instead was inputted into their computer system that I now have a balance of {$1300.00} because I was asking them to return to me any excess monies paid to them after satisfying my account balance. because by law it is rightfully mine and should have been returned to me as soon as the payments were made. not only did they not supply me with any of my paperwork to document any of the details and how the appropriated any of the refund money but I also never received the title for the vehicle in which the entire loan payment was made for. As well as they have now somehow added a {$1400.00} charge to my account but have no documentation explaining why or how that number was reached or why they feel entitled to such an amount. It is also incurring interest as if I was still under contract with them which is false because the terms of the contract were met and the account was closed and that was explained to me in one of the phone calls that I made to them. they should not be allowed to charge me for attempted charge me any money without them furnishing up and supplying the paperwork necessary to substantiate such claims. They also negatively impacted by credit score for months after the accident stating that I was past due on payments when in fact they had already received payment the loan. So all around this company is doing awful business they are not meeting terms that they should be and are not supplying any paperwork as to their conduct on that side of the contract. I have upheld my side of the contract and I believe that they should be held to theirs as well. There's a lot of unscrupulous behavior going on within this company, and that is some evident.

Consumer complaint narrative: I have an auto loan with Exeter finance. Ive had this loan for almost 6 years. I am supposed to have two remaining payments in the amount of {$380.00}. I received a letter from them stating that there is an extra almost {$1500.00} worth of interest applied to my loan because they put two loan payments on the end of my loan five years ago. No one ever told me that they were going to be assessing an extra {$1500.00} worth of interest, and then they send me a letter threatening to report me to the credit bureau if I dont have that extra {$1500.00} paid off by the end of my loan on XX/XX/XXXX. This loan has been current for five years or so. I attempted to call them and speak to them about it, theyre trying to tell me that what theyre doing is OK and that I have to pay it and if I dont pay it then theyre going to repo my car and report me to the credit bureau. I have made 70 payments on this car, Im supposed to have two remaining payments, I signed a contract for 72 payments, and now they want me to come up with an extra {$1500.00} in a month. I asked them to produce proof that someone even spoke to me about this or I signed something saying that theyre going to assess an extra {$1500.00} and the woman told me because Im in Florida that they dont have to do that. I dont understand how a business can be deceptive and then take something from me that I have paid for for six years.

Complaint against Marcus Goldman Sachs online savings bank. 

I was trying to open a Marcus Goldman Sachs online savings account. I completed my application by entering my name, address, date of birth, social security number, etc. However, my application was declined for no apparent reason. So I decided to place a call to its customer service in an attempt to find out why. I was told by a supervisor that the reason my application was rejected due to them unable to verify my identity. When I offered to provide my state ID to confirm my identity, they refused. The supervisor said Marcus does not perform additional identity verification check. That seems strange to me. Why a bank does not want a customers money? Why they dont even try to verify applicants identity? All of the information I provided are sensitive personal information which can be used to commit illegal personal identity frauds. I suspect this online division of the banks real business is collecting peoples personal information then later sell it for money. Please investigate.

I contacted Bridgecrest XX/XX/2019 and spoke with XXXX to discuss the inaccurate information on my CBR. I'm currently on a payment plan paying {$290.00} every 2 weeks. I was never advised when I set up the plan, rather by phone speaking to rep ( back XX/XX/2019 ) or via the online portal, that I would continue to report delinquent during the plan. 

I'm currently in the process of purchasing a home and that's when I noticed that I was reporting 3 months past due. However, I have continued to make my agreed upon payments. 

During the conversation with XXXX, I advised that I understood the first delinquency hit as I set up the arrangement after the account was already 31 days delinquent. The days delinquency referenced was provided by XXXX during our conversation as I was unaware how far behind, I may have been. XXXX stated she saw where Bridgecrest tried to contact me prior to the payment arrangement to prevent it from hitting my CBR. She advised that if I SPOKE with someone I would have known. However, I did speak with someone and it was never brought up. 

I asked if there was someone, I could speak to that would help me rectify this. She advised that all disputes would need to go through the credit agencies. 

Several times during the convo XXXX advised that she was reviewing notes and dates incorrectly. I'm sure she is very proficient in her knowledge of how to read account notes, there were times that the information that was shared was " off '' as she stated that she doesn't show when I spoke with someone. Sub-issue: Loan balance remaining after the vehicle is repossessed and sold
Consumer complaint narrative:
My vehicle ( a XXXX XXXX XXXX  XXXX ), was repossessed 2 days before XXXX XXXX. This occurred after I repetitively sent letters to capital one indicating financial hardship due to automobile accident involving the seat belt and brake component of the vehicle and that the above vehicle was involved in a National recall for model years XXXX to XXXX. 
I also notified Capital one that I have obtained a lawyer to assist me due to the fact the manufacturer at that time was not able to fix the issue until sometime the next year and this along with a faulty engine qualifies the vehicle as a lemon. 
After realizing that the vehicle was repossessed, I immediately logged into the online portal. Upon indebt review of the account, I saw that of the original loan amount of {$27000.00}, I had a paid to date total of {$33000.00}, and of the {$33000.00} that was paid {$20000.00} was applied to interest and only {$12000.00} applied to the principal. 
At no time upon accepting the auto loan with Capital one was I informed or notified that majority of payments would be applied to interest as opposed to the principal. Additionally there was an exorbitant amount of fees and charges being applied to the account in addition to reporting of late payments and repossession when there was none thus negatively impacting my credit score and history. Also at the initiation of the loan I was informed of an added bonus of Gap coverage for the vehicle since it was a brand new vehicle, to which I learned was never included at the time of engine failure in XXXX which required a brand new engine. 
Capital one sent a letter dated XX/XX/XXXX which stated the vehicle will be sold after XX/XX/XXXX. About 2 weeks after I received a call from Capital one stating the vehicle was sold. When I requested the amount that the vehicle was sold for the representative declined to disclose that information. Fast forward to this year and review of my credit report I see that capital one had continued to report to all credit reporting agencies that I had an active auto loan the was months past due and horrifically reflected a balance as if the vehicle was still in my possession. There was also a failure on Capital One 's behalf to report the $ XXXX that was already paid to them in addition to the {$2700.00} that was paid to them on XX/XX/XXXX, which would have a ) brought my account current and b ) prevented the repossession from ever occurring. Lastly, in XXXX of XXXX I applied for economic hardship which would allow for lower payments to be made for a certain number of months not to exceed 12 months. However when approval was obtained the monthly payments was lowered slightly from {$630.00} a month to {$550.00} a month with a additional charge for notifying the lender of hardship and approval for lowered payments thus extending the loan term from 72 months at XXXX/monthly to 96 months at $ XXXX/monthly!!! 
In summary, Capital One Auto finance uses deceptive marketing and financial practices when dealing with individuals with less than optimum credit and most disheartening they use predatory lending practices in the form of interest rates such as mine which was 26.98 %. 
Applying that high interest rate to monthly payments and late payments thus padding overall charges leading to inability to remain current with payments. The subsequent repossession of this vehicle also served as a removal of evidence for the lawsuit that was initiated for defects that XXXX XXXX XXXX admitted to not having a resolution for and in a email to me indicating that the company would reimburse me for renting a vehicle on a monthly basis due to the open recall whilst still liable for loan payments to Capital one. Thus ensuring there was no tangible evidence within my possession in the form of the vehicle to produce to investigators and lawyers.

Consumer complaint narrative: The company in which I have a vehicle loan went out of business due to fraudulent activities to thousands of people like myself. I am attaching websites to show the length of unethical activities they participated in as it relates to my own situation. Apparently, when they went out of business, they sold the existing vehicle loans to a unknowingly third party company in which they did not transfer accurate records. I have been locked out of the online portal of my online account several times after calling the number given to me from the former Gateway One company to reach the third party company that is supposed to be handling the completion of the vehicle loans after the company went out of business. I have called hundreds of times to fight to gain access to my statement after the third party company told me verbally over the phone that my balance was always over {$900.00} even after I called in to pay my bill, the balance never went down. I was transferred from another country ( where the 1-800 #  routes you to ) and I requested to speak with someone in America. Everytime I was transferred to someone in America, they told me that they did not see that I owed {$900.00} plus dollars. The third party company outside of America stated that I had two repossessions of this vehicle and that is what made up the extra money owed. My vehicle has never been repossessed. I have never received any court documents, certified mail or notification of a repossion since I have owned this vehicle. The vehicle has never been taken from me in any way. I again called hundreds of times to find out how this happened. I was hung up on from the international person that transferred me over for several months. I contacted my local attorney general 's office to get help. They researched this and told me that their were thousands of complaints and the company was forced out of business by the courts. They helped me get Gateway one to give me access to the statement so that I could see the false charges on my statement. They also helped me put a fraud alert on all of my credit reports. They stated that since the company was out of business, the credit reports would investigate it and remove it. After I gained access to my online statement, I saw the false repossession charges myself. I called back again to Gateway One and asked to speak with someone in America. I spoke to a woman who introduced herself as the manager of the  repossession department. She stated that her name was XXXX. She put me on hold and pulled up my account number. She came back on the line and stated, no you do not have any repossessions under your account. I will contact the accounting department to have this removed. I asked for a copy of all of my records from Gateway One to  ensure that nothing was showing up under my name. The attorney general also asked me to do this so that I can see any certified mail, court documents or FDIC required documents that Gateway One would have had to file in order to initiate or administer a repossession under my name. I was told that since their was no repossession, there was nothing that she could send me. So, the attorney general helped me mail a packet of evidence to each credit bureau to get the false and inflated repossession charges off my statement so that I can have the correct pay-off amount. I paid it down to under {$2000.00} at this point, but with the fees, it is still showing over {$4000.00} in error. When the credit bureaus investigated this, Gateway One ( who refused to respond to me or the attorney general with evidence of any repossession paperwork or notification date and sign stamped or certified ) send false statements to the credit bureau and are continuing to report the wrong amount on my credit report. This has been going on for over two and a half years. After Gateway One went out of business, the new administrator has told me several times that they have no evidence or paperwork of any repossession under my name. However, after the credit reporting agencies investigated them, they must have supplied false documents to get the credit agencies to keep the wrong amount on file which shows not only one, but TWO repossessions. I called back to Gateway One after getting an update from the credit bureaus. I spoke to XXXX who stated that he was the manager. He again assured me that no repossessions were showing up under this account and that he was going to speak to his manager to review the statement and have an updated copy showing no false repossession fees. He stated that he would mail me a copy of the updated statement showing me the accurate pay-off amount so that I could pay it off and have the correct amount. He never contacted me back. A few months went by and Gateway One again sent a 3rd party person in another company to call me stating that I owed over {$900.00} including two repossession fees. The company went out of business due to falsifying thousands of people like my account. It has been very frustrating to try to show integrity and pay off this loan when they refuse to remove false repossession fees and destroying my credit. I would like to see a copy of the certified court stamped repossession documents signed by a judge, a copy of all of my internal records from Gateway One and all of their third party contractors and a copy of the information they submitted to all three credit bureaus. This evidence will provide clear proof that these repossession fees are fake and are being used to harass consumers like me when companies are exposed for not honoring the FDIC and Consumer Protection laws. Please help me, please! These people don't care about no one!
Company public response: Company believes complaint is the result of an isolated error

The next day I went back to XXXX  XXXX  XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX and waited for a police officer to arrive so that I could file a police report. Once the police arrived the same manager that told me he didn't know where my XXXX   was came forward to say the XXXX was towed away a week prior. I said if you weren't taking it as a trade why would you allow me to leave it there, accept my keys and then have it towed away?? Why wouldn't you just tell me you didn't accept it as a trade. After I told him the situation he said he didn't want to be a part of that situation since it sounded like the dealership wasn't honest so he only charged me {$250.00}. After getting my XXXX back I called Chrysler and explained to them everything that happened. They escalated my complaint and said they would have someone review it. However, it was to no avail. They said I would still have to pay for the XXXX  I was sold. I then told Chrysler that I could not afford to pay for a new XXXX in addition to my XXXX  plus full coverage for both vehicles so I would have to voluntarily surrender it. They sent someone to pick it up. They told me it would be sold at auction and I would responsible for the balance. I have received a letter from current creditor XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX stating that the original creditor was Santander ( I have no knowledge of Santander ) and the account name is Chrysler Capital saying that I owe them {$7900.00}. I can not pay this, it has already put a huge dent in my credit and I do not have the money to pay this debt. Can you help me???

Sub-issue: Problem with additional products or services purchased with the loan
Consumer complaint narrative: I purchased a car from DriveTime on XXXX XXXX in XXXX XXXX on XX/XX/XXXX. I financed through XXXX, the in-house bank. The entire process took all day and when it came time to sign my documents there were three aftermarket products, from XXXX, added to my loan that ended up costing an extra {$5200.00}. I asked the salesman what they were and he was a little surprised that NO ONE had gone over or tried to sell them to me, instead, I bought ALL of them without my consent or even any knowledge of what they were. So when I told the guy I dont want or need them the manager came over and said we would have to start the whole process over to take them off. I suppose thats part of the scam. I was exhausted at this point and he says or you can just call and easily have them canceled. I have called and submitted the cancellation forms multiple times and they are still on my car loan and I am being charged interest. Not just an easy phone call as promised! I want the products removed from my loan immediately and I want every penny of interest that I have paid on the aftermarket amount, beginning from day one, credited back to my account. XXXX, of course, is refusing to take them off. On top of that, I was behind on my car payment but got caught up on all payments on XX/XX/XXXX by making a payment of {$2300.00} to them. The gal said that would make me current. On XX/XX/XXXX I logged in to check my account and like she said it was paid up and current. It also stated my next payment date was XX/XX/XXXX and I owed {$130.00} ( I have a screenshot of this as proof ). I log on to pay it on XX/XX/XXXX to make sure I don't fall behind and it says my account is past due in the amount of {$200.00}!!! I call and they tell me too bad it must have updated and refuses to take the late fee off. So apparently the Drivetime store managers lie to your face and they back them up, the customer service reps lie and tell you you are caught up, and the computer account screen is a liar as well. I want nothing to do with this company or any of its affiliates and would pay off the loan but I REFUSE to pay for the {$5200.00} in illegal add ons by scams, lies, and disgraceful behavior to a first-time car buyer but of course they refuse to do the right thing. I understand the contract but as I said I was scammed by the manager. He encouraged me to sign the contract with the products on it like it was the only choice I had. I have never been this blatantly taken advantage of in my life and I want this brought to every consumer 's attention in the US to warn them to under NO circumstance should they believe any manager,  customer service rep or even the account you log into for information at XXXX. I am sick and tired of XXXX  unwilling attitude to do the right thing and just remove the products and any interest that I have paid on that amount. Maybe this is all part of the way they make money, all part of a bigger scam starting the process at DriveTime and continuing it with XXXX? If it wasn't part of a scam I would think that they would immediately do the only honest thing to resolve this. I guess they are not a company with any values or willingness to help customers who get taken advantage of by them. I have NEVER used or wanted the products, and yet they still want to collect my money for them. I have already contacted an investigative department to do a story about this and they are interested. I guarantee once it airs on TV they will have MANY, MANY more complaints about the same type of scam then just mine. I would also like to see what legal actions can be taken? I understand the contract and all but that is why law enforcement has fraud departments to help people who were taken advantage of by businesses that refuse to make their bad decision right. I will call the top CEO, the IRS, the FBI, the police department and TV studios if I need too. Please let me know what to do next because I will never stop until they take these products off my loan that they illegally put on. Maybe they need a class on how to be a better business! I am sorry to take up your time because of big business thinking they can get away with this. I will be waiting to hear back and take the next extremely necessary step to correct the mistake they stand behind.

Issue: Problem caused by your funds being low
Consumer complaint narrative: I have a " Money Market Savings Account '' with Bank of America. When I go online to the account info for this specific account, there is a link to " View fee schedule '' which takes me to a PDF outlining the fees. Note, this PDF is listed under the account info for this particular Money Market savings account, not somewhere else generically on the BoA website. When I review the PDF with account fees, it lists a variety of savings and checking account options and their associated fees. None of them has a name that exactly matches up with mine ( Money Market Savings ) but I reviewed all the accounts listed and saw that for all the possible accounts, I should be able to avoid fees if I keep a balance over {$1500.00}. With this information, I made a transfer out of my saving account that kept me above {$1500.00} but then I started to get $ XXXX/month fees! After many phone calls, it turns out that I have a " grandfathered '' in account that was not listed on the PDF ( and this PDF is posted under the account info ) and my account actually has a lower limit of {$2500.00}! But there was no way to know this from the information listed online, and instead the link to " View fee schedule '' provided me with incorrect information which led me to believe that the lower limit was {$1500.00}, not {$2500.00}. After many much arguing with Bank of America, they have refunded my fees. However, this seems like a systematic problem that must be fixed for other customers. The customers must be able to get the correct fee information about their account and especially must not be given incorrect information on their account pages.
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response

This is incredibly deceptive practices on the part of Bridgecrest as most borrowers would likely think it's their lucky day and not realize the deception that had occurred since they were not given the option to set their payment schedule up to pay ahead ( and would not have known this before cancelling the current arrangement. )

Sub-issue: Problem using a debit or ATM card
Consumer complaint narrative:
My complaint is simple : fraud occurred on my Charles Schwab accounts attached to my brokerage accounts, it was reported in a timely manner, and I have not been refunded almost one year later. Multiple Charles Schwab representatives have left me hanging for almost 12 months, some making false promises only to pass the buck to a different customer service agent. Schwab promises its clients, Schwab will cover 100 % of any losses in any of your Schwab accounts due to unauthorized activity. It offers two caveats : 1 ) a customer must safeguard his or her accounts by not sharing account access information and 2 ) reporting the fraud as quickly as possible. As such, my hospital stay was one in which an order for XXXX XXXX was entered to save my life. I did not give any information whatsoever to any person on earth, and I reported the fraud as soon as I was out of the hospital and had access to my belongings once again ( they had been in a XXXX locker for weeks ). I have never shared the actual debit card nor have I given out my PIN number to a single soul. Per Schwabs request, I gave them the suspect name XXXX XXXX in XX/XX/XXXX. 

A brief narrative : After a XXXX XXXX stay for stage XXXX XXXX XXXX from XX/XX/XXXX till XX/XX/XXXX, I returned home to fraudulent actions on both my checking and savings accounts at Charles Schwab. The nature of the criminal activity is debit card abuse at an ATM. There were 3 errors on my checking and 56 on my savings. The fraudulent activity included a series of XX/XX/XXXX ATM cash withdrawals ( done in increments of {$200.00} and {$400.00} ) topping {$18000.00} done over the time period of my XXXX XXXX. The address for the criminal activity is XXXX XXXX XXXX in XXXX, Texas. All fraudulent transactions took place while I was XXXX   at XXXX. I immediately reported the fraud to Charles Schwab, and the claim is still pending with them. The debit card number used in these fraudulent transactions is XXXX. 

I submitted all requested documentation to Charles Schwab, including a police report and confirmation of my XXXX XXXX. The police also confirmed my XXXX XXXX and stated for the record that I was defrauded. I was initially refunded by XXXX XXXX before it was soon reversed with no notification or warning. Several months later XXXX XXXX promised to refund me on three occasions before blaming not being able to do so on a committee. The latest representative from the Client Advocacy Team, XXXX XXXX, has told me he will look into how the fraud was not detected when it was completely different to my patterns over the years ( I do not use ATMs ). Telephone banker XXXX XXXX on XX/XX/XXXX, told me my personal banker was  XXXX XXXX. This lined up with the series of sales emails I received from him, and so I directly called and emailed him with no response. After the contact and a mention of filing a complaint, he was surreptitiously removed from my accounts. Charles Schwab accepted no responsibility for this error and blamed it on me. As a customer, this meant no one over the phone or at the branch was willing to stand by the Schwab guarantee. This is terrible and unacceptable and a complete violation of my financial rights. 

These events are terrifying to any customer, but to go through this on your XXXX when you need the funds for a XXXX XXXX and your family ( my wife is XXXX with our XXXX XXXX ),  it is especially troubling and traumatic. Rather than making positional personal assumptions, Schwab should stand by a defrauded customer and not ignore its security guarantee to bully a XXXX customer. 

Charles Schwab has not stood by its security guarantee in protecting my accounts. I ask that this be escalated within the bank to a leader who can rectify the situation and finally restore me for the fraud I have endured. 

I am also submitting this claim on behalf of my wife, XXXX, who is a signer on the accounts. Thank you for your time and please let me know if I can be if any assistance in facilitating a resolution.
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response

Consumer complaint narrative:

My credit score was XXXX w no history. They approved me @ 16 %. I agreed knowing I needed a few weeks to get the $ to pay the loan off. I called today XX/XX/2020, was told the payoff was {$28000.00}.

Consumer complaint narrative: XX/XX/XXXX - I went to XXXX  XXXX dealer and bought a new car.I gave them {$5.00} down payment in cash, paid {$550.00} for a GAP insurance and financed the rest of the value with the Financial Institution First Help Financial , which was indicated by the Salesman and negotiated by him. All negotiation was done by Salesman which I have emails that proved that I gave him my personal information. It was the first time that I was buying a new car so he told me that it would be better if I give my personal information to him so he could deal with the financial institution. XXXX- After almost of 2 years paying my auto loan on time ( paid {$17000.00} ) and without any late payment I contacted the financial institution First Help Financial to inform them that due to Covid- 19 Pandemic I had a substantial loss of income and I could not pay my loan on time the way that I was doing for all the time that I had my car loan. XXXXEven with all challenges due to this pandemic and my economic hardship situation I paid my car loan and they charged me a late fee. After this payment I asked the institution to send my contract copy loan so I could compare with the contract that I had in my hands and see if I could refinance my car loan with another financial institution with a better interest rate since my credit score improved drastically. XXXX First Help Financial sent the contract to me and for my surprise the contract that they sent has a signature that was not mine. IT WAS FORGED. Another thing is that the contract that they sent to me was different from the one that I signed with the XXXX XXXX XXXX. The amount financed is different from the contract that I have in my hands. Also the down payment value is different and the gap insurance does not appear in the forged contract. XX/XX/XXXX After realizing that FRAUD I contacted XXXX XXXX dealership by email and by phone and asked them to send the contract in my email. The contract that they sent to me has the same FORGED SIGNATURE which I do not recognize as mine. XX/XX/XXXX I contacted XXXX XXXX and First Help Financial again by phone and by email and explained that the signature is not mine and I do not recognize that contract. I also contacted the GAP insurance company XXXX XXXX, which is the company that the salesman told me that I have my GAP insurance/ contract signed by me and the company said that according to my VIN number they never had any contract with them. I have in my hands a contract with GAP Insurance which I bought at the moment that my cars purchase. After realizing that I was the victim of a scam I am constantly trying to contact the companies involved in this contract. All emails and documents that I have proves my situation and how hard I am willing to solve this problem. I had a financial loss but more than that I am concerned about my signature being frauded.I do not trust XXXX  XXXX and First Help financial anymore and I want to void the contract, my money back and return the car. With all documents and emails I can easily prove that my signature was forged. As a result of this unfair or deceptive act or practice, I suffered injury or loss of money as follows : {$5.00} Down Payment, {$550.00} GAP Insurance ( XXXX  XXXX ) {$17000.00} ( First Help financial )

Consumer complaint narrative: I am formally listing a complaint against iLendingDirect.com. I received an offer for credit to refinance my vehicle at 84 months with a 3 % rate indicating an approval for the terms based on a soft inquiry. The lender then proceeded to make an unauthorized hard inquiry and offered terms substantially different than the terms ( 100bps higher ) expressed in the offering. Their marketing strategy is deceptive, offering teaser rates and terms they are not able reasonably extend to an individual. As this company has engaged in such deceptive tactics, I felt it necessary to report this activity to the CPFB. Please contact me with additional questions.
Company public response: Company believes the complaint is the result of a misunderstanding

Consumer complaint narrative: On XX/XX/19, I purchased a used vehicle financed through Santander Consumer USA. I was informed the first payment will go out approximately 45 days from date of purchase. On XX/XX/2019, I received the first statement in the mail a few days after the statement generated. The statement reads bill due XX/XX/19. I went ahead and paid my first bill in XX/XX/2019.On XX/XX/XXXX, a second statement is generated by Billing Dept from Santander stating the bill owed for $XXXX due on XX/XX/19. Although it states current on the bill. The amount of $XXXX is not been applied for the bill due XX/XX/19, for which was paid on XX/XX/19.I called and spoke to an agent who requested I wait up to a week for the billing department to fix the mistake. After 6 days, I called and was told it has not been fixed. On day 8 ( XX/XX/19) I speak to an agent who finally understood the issue but failed to ignore my request to have a supervisor escalate the issue. On my screen in shows PAST DUE as in delinquent on the XX/XX/19 due date. After 30 minutes on waiting on the phone, I spoke with Supervisor named XXXX. She put me on hold and then said: "Because you paid your bill 30 days earlier, we applied that towards your principal."I firmly stated that this was not my objective but to pay my first bill as it was sent out 30 days earlier from billing department and now I am being punished for paying my first bill due. Clearly not a valid excuse on Santander. I demanded my payment be accredited to my account as there is only 1 bill due and I paid it already. I ask them to fix my account and get it right the first time. After another hold, she returned by stating they need another 3-5 days to fix the mistake. She stated the first agent put in a request for a due date issue and not the issue of the erroneous mistake made by their own billing department with regards to my new loan account. Once again, I am at their mercy to do what is right and fix my account to accredit the payment made in XX/XX/XXXX to reflect the payment due for XX/XX/19.This is not ethical nor a legal transaction that has occurred but rather an unscrupulous attempt to con me into paying off principal at their discretion and ignoring the first payment for the new auto loan. I would like to proceed and continue to file this grievance to the fullest extent of the law.Thank you.

By this means I request to be removed some accounts that are getting confused in my credit reports, I have never lived in the United States and in spite of the efforts I have made since XX/XX/2018 have not yet been removed. The accounts of XXXX / XXXX  # XXXX and XXXX # XXXX confused in my report are reporting recent backlogs which make it impossible and this is affecting my credit. 

I request the removal of variations of names mixed in my reports such as XXXX XXXX XXXX, addresses of the United States and Jobs that do not belong to me XXXX XXXX XXXX There are some positive accounts as they do not belong to me and they are still reprinting in my reports that I request to be removed, XXXX XXXX # XXXX, XXXX # XXXX, XXXX / XXXX XXXX # XXXX, XXXX # XXXX, XXXX / XXXX # XXXX, XXXX / XXXX XXXX # XXXX, XXXX XXXX # XXXX, XXXX XXXX # XXXX, XXXX XXXX # XXXX I request to be corrected and do not confuse again information of other people in my credit.

Just this month ( XX/XX/XXXX ), a " late payment '' hit my credit report while I am in the middle of purchasing a house. I logged into the TD Auto Finance website ( which I never do b/c the payments are made in person at TD Bank counter ) and there was nothing obviously that would show anything was 30+ days late. What I did see was what the balance due for " XX/XX/XXXX '' which is what they are stating is the missed/late payment. I called TD, spoke with a representative yesterday ( XX/XX/XXXX ). They stated that there was a payment missed in XX/XX/XXXX. It clearly was an accident because every payment before and after that has been on time and always more than the minimum. I was never notified about a missing payment. TD stated that do not call for missed payments but only send notices in the mail. I have never received one. They also said they sent me monthly statements, which I also have never received and they are looking into that. The on-line message center also has no notification in there under my account. When they told me it was late, I immediately paid the outstanding balance, which was less than a monthly payment due to all the over payments. Not only did they not make a fair attempt to contact me, they reported {$88.00} as " 30 days late '' with the credit bureaus but posted it on my credit 9 months later as if i was recently late. Had they either called me and/or even added it my credit when it was truly late, I would have paid it immediately. Now my current home loan I'm working on is at risk. They told me there was no phone or e-mail to contact anyone, I would only be able to mail my complaint to the Credit Dispute Department. My home is supposed to close in less than 3 weeks and this is now an issue.

In XXXX I was double charged for my truck payment. When I contacted Westlake financial they said they would try to money transfer it back into my account if not they would send me the double payment check via standard mail. Then 2 weeks later I reached out to them they said it didnt work. I asked to have the check resent. Then Once 8 business days had passed and I have not received the check in the mail, I called back and asked to have the check canceled and just applied to XXXX truck payment. The women told me no problem she just had to email the accounting department to have them do so. I would see it applied with 48 hours. That was Monday XX/XX/XXXX. Then on XX/XX/XXXX. ( The day my payment is due ) I received an email stating i am late on my payment. I have call numerous times asking to have it fixed and asking for a supervisor. Every time I was either told they do not have supervisors, or put on hold for hours at a time. Or just hung up on. Then today XX/XX/XXXX I called, finally was given to a floor lead person named indigo, she told me theres nothing they can do but send another email asking approval for them the send another check for the payment I was double charge. Which I could be denied for again. which will take 7-10 business days do them to start the process. but if I dont pay my payment within 8 days they are going to start charging me late fees if I dont pay it soon.
