Issue: Problem with a lender or other company charging your account
Consumer complaint narrative:
On XX/XX/XXXX at XXXX when attempting to transfer money from my checking account to my savings I noticed that {$9500.00} was missing from the account and that on XX/XX/XXXX ( 4 days prior ) {$9500.00} had been wired to a XXXX XXXX XXXX Bank Account to an individual I have never heard of. I have never initiated a wire transfer in my life, nor did I initiate this wire transfer, nor have I ever been asked to provided written authorization for wire transfers. I promptly called my bank, USAA, and informed them of the fraudulent activity. A report was made, and an investigation began, and I was reassured I would get the funds returned to the account. Within an hour of initiating the report, I received a call from the fraud investigator assigned to my case. She proceeded to tell me that because the fraudster was able to get into my account easily using my username and password that USAA was not liable for recouping the funds lost. She stated a recall on the wire was sent and an investigation would follow. I never heard back from the fraud team, was never asked any questions or asked to give any information to help with the investigation. The evening of XX/XX/XXXX I called USAA to receive further clarification on how it is possible that I would be held liable for fraudulent activity that the bank allowed regardless of various elements of the activity that should have raised red flags. Red flags that should have been raised regarding the wire transfer include the following : I have never signed anything stating that I authorize wire transfers from any of my accounts, I have never conducted a wire transfer before in my life let alone with USAA, the request was presumably from a unauthorized IP address on an unauthorized device, for the amount of {$9500.00} ( only XXXX less than the amount legally required to be reported federally ). I am left to assume the wire was initiated from and sent to a distant location as no one at USAA could give me any information on the IP address where the wire was initiated or sent. Not keeping record of this data alone is suspicious for negligence in addition to the fact that USAA 's " verification '' process for a wire transfer of half the funds in an account is not commercially reasonable. The " verification '' process for the wire transfer included inserting user name and password. There was apparently a code sent to an email address on file. However, I have only received verification codes sent in the form of text messages to my mobile phone and have never verified my identity via email. I also have no record of such an email. In addition, because this is not routinely the verification method used or agreed upon by the Bank and the Service,  USAA should be liable for any losses through the fraudulent transfer. 

After the call with USAA on the evening of the XXXX I called the XX/XX/XXXX police department to file a police report. I was informed by the police that without the location of where the wire was initiated or sent to I would be unable to properly file a report in correct jurisdiction. 

On the morning of the XXXX of XX/XX/XXXXI called USAA to reach the wire department to try to obtain information regarding the location of the transfer to file the report. No one was able to give me that information further delaying the police report. I was sent to wire resolutions who informed me I should be protected as the wire was clearly fraudulent and I was a victim of an account take over. I was then transferred to the Account Takeover Team who told me I was not a victim of account takeover but actually considered a third party to a scam due to the fact my information was compromised. After denying my right to be protected against fraudulent transactions reported well within the 60 days of the event I requested to escalate the situation to the manager. After reviewing my file the manager of the Account Takeover Team informed me that there was a letter addressed to me in my file stating that my request for return of funds had been denied and the case had been closed. This was the first I had heard of this resolution as I had not been contacted by the Fraud Investigators since XX/XX/XXXX when they informed me that all they could do was initiate a wire recall. The manager proceeded to file a complaint to the CEO on my behalf and told me there was no one else who I would be able to speak to regarding the matter. 

The afternoon of XX/XX/XXXX I filed a police report with XX/XX/XXXX police. I also filed a report with the FBI, Ic3.gov which is a division of the FBI, the FTC Federal Trade Commission , and the CFPB Consumer Financial Protection Bureau . I also initiated fraud monitoring through the three credit Bureaus : XXXX, XXXX, and XXXX. I am awaiting a response from the CEO of  USAA for approval of return of the lost funds totaling {$9500.00}.
Company public response: Company believes it acted appropriately as authorized by contract or law

Consumer complaint narrative: Unable to come to an agreement on interest rates on used car loan when my credit was good. Now Im behind on payments and my credit got worse I e been upside down on this loan with no recourse.

Multiple times I would keep getting a " technical difficulties '' message and could hardly work around their site. As a result, I was not allowed to make payments ( in addition to my auto-enrolled payments ) for weeks at a time. This impacts me in that I should have had lower principal being impacted by interest. By now it's a couple hundred dollars that I am behind due to their site issues. It is a complete joke to have  a website and have it have no capabilities. 

Additionally, their website is so poorly laid-out and managed that you will have no idea what your payments are and how they are being applied ( principal vs interest ). 

They have a secure message option on the website, but they are incapable of responding via email through this option - you will only receive auto-replies that include symbols making it appear as if this whole thing is a scam ( still not convinced it isn't at this point ). 

These auto-replies are only capable of saying TD Auto can not respond via email and you must call them ... which is a waste of time, unless you enjoy sitting on the phone for an hour to remedy absolutely nothing.

Approximately 2 months ago, an online profile was set up with USAA, both for my father ( a veteran ) and myself. The account setup was successful, and a deal was made at my local XXXX dealer. The dealer asked me to call USAA to get the loan process started, and I was informed that my account was blocked and USAA reserved the right to do business with me. My husband and I were concerned, becuase we have strong credit scores and have never been refused credit before. We came home and checked our credit reports, which were in order. The next several days were spent on the phone with various departments of USAA, no one had an explanation, except to say that fraud was suspected and that I should write to the legal department, which I did. An investigator from the fraud department was in touch, and after his investigation, he held that USAA refused to do business with myself and/or my father, no explanation would be given. I believe as a financial consumer, I have the right to know why I was denied an opportunity to apply for credit. Also, no written notification was given.
Company public response: Company believes it acted appropriately as authorized by contract or law

Consumer complaint narrative:
On XX/XX/XXXX I called credit acceptance because I noticed the last bit of my payment didn't come off on the XXXX like it usually does. I didn't think much of it at the time, thinking it would charge me the next day. Not until I checked my credit report and noticed I dropped 56 points. The company had marked my XXXX payment as 30 days late when not even a day has passed. I called on the XXXX and was not even able to get an answer to how this happen. They just wanted me to pay what was due which was XXXX and some change. The first gentleman didn't even try to listen to me stating my payment was XXXX, and once I paid this off the account would be closed. I finally got to send a dispute on behalf after questioning it several times. I had questions on how this can happen, and he absolutely refused to help me what so ever. Just trying to get me to pay despite my understanding it should have been taken out of my account already. I finally went to pay over phone and there was a fee attach to pay over the phone. So not only did they drop my credit score for a payment that was never late, but they wanted me to spend extra to pay what was left. I called to get a person again, and once more had trouble getting any help. The woman stated my auto pay was canceled and said I must have canceled it. Which is not true. When it was set up I was told it would go until I didn't owe anymore. Again it was hard to get any answers out of her. When I asked about me getting marked late she said I've been late on my payment which is not true. I had one late in XX/XX/2016 which I quickly cleared up. In almost 3 years I've been on top of payments and not once was I ever told I was behind. She remarked saying I rarely called and I let her know I didn't have a reason to call. My payments came out on time with no worries all 3 years. Honestly I'm extremely frustrated because I've been working so hard to get my credit up, and at the whim of this company they decided to mark me late for no reason. Then when I try to get an answer I get no help just saying to pay the rest to close the account. Then the real kicker is make me pay a small fee to pay off the rest of my account. The money isn't the issue here. It '' s the fact that the customer service was utterly lacking and has an impact on my credit score. If I try to finance a car again, and it had to be with this company again. I'll just take an uber until I can pay the car off fully in cash. 

P.s I'm adding screenshots to show how I've been on time for 3 years. How this has affected my credit score. Proof that I paid the remaining amount off. I dont have my bank statements included because I'm not sure if you wish to dig thru 3 years of bank statements, but I will be happy to provide that if it comes down to it.
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response

Sub-issue: Loan balance remaining after the vehicle is repossessed and sold
Consumer complaint narrative: I have checked my XXXX and XXXX credit reports. I have noticed that the account with Santander regarding a car loan still reflects a balance for {$12000.00}. But this amount was charged off.

On XX/XX/2019 at XXXX XXXX, I received a call from the number XXXX from a person claiming to be a Bank of America representative who said that the system has detected a fraud activity on my account. She requested that I give her the three-digit security code on the back of my Bank of America debit card in order to confirm my identity. I thought that this was a scam call so I hung up. 

I immediately logged into my Bank of America Mobile Banking Application on my phone to check my accounts. When I tried to log in, I received an alert that my password had been changed and that my account had been locked. I reset my password and continued on with my day. 

The next day, XX/XX/2019, while checking my banking mobile app, I saw that a transaction Discover Card ending in XXXX for the amount of {$5700.00} was made on my Bank of America Advantage Savings Account. I called Bank of America to report that I had not made/authorized this transaction. I filed a claim to get my money back as this transaction was still pending and I was told that the process would take 7-10 business days.

The representative stated that someone had gained access to my bank account using my username and password, and this person asked me to reset my username and password in order to prevent further fraud activity on my account. While speaking to the representative, I saw that there were two more transactions being made on the same Savings account : the first being a transaction for {$4300.00} under the name XXXX XXXX Credit Card ending in XXXX, and the second transaction for {$5400.00} under the name XXXX XXXX Credit Card ending in XXXX. These two transactions had been declined.

I called the Bank of America Fraud Claims Department ( XXXX ) several times between XX/XX/2019 and XX/XX/2019 to get updates on the status of the claim but was told that I would have to wait the full 10 business days before anything could be done. 

On XX/XX/2019, I reached out to the Bank of America Fraud Claims Department because 10 business days had passed since I had submitted my claim. I was surprised to hear that my claim had been denied on XX/XX/2019. Bank of America claims that this transaction had been performed from my device with the same IP address that I always use to access my Mobile Banking Application. I reinforced that I had not made this transaction and that I do not even have any Credit Cards accounts with XXXX or XXXX XXXX. The Bank of America Fraud Claims representative told me that this denial decision was final, unless I could bring forth evidence that my phone had been hacked with a virus or malware at the time of the fraudulent transaction. 

The representative then advised my to speak to my phone provider ( XXXX ) to run a virus scan on my XXXXXXXX XXXX device. I visited two XXXX stores and both claimed that they do not run such virus scans. I reached out to the Bank of America Fraud Claims Department again to inform them of this. Another representative then advised me to visit a XXXX location near me to run a virus test on my device. I followed the representatives instructions and went to a XXXX location and after purchasing an anti-virus software, I was informed that there were several viruses on my device that the software was able to remove. I faxed a letter from the XXXX technical department to the Bank of America Fraud Claims Department to prove that my device had in fact been hacked. 

I called XXXX Customer Service to see if any fraudulent activity had been detected on my device. However, I was told that they could not detect any fraudulent activity on my account. 

I even reached out to XXXX Customer Service to see if any fraudulent activity had been detected on my email since this email address was linked with the bank account at the time. They were not able to detect any fraudulent activity. 

I approached the police department to file a police report and was told that I would need an Affidavit from Bank of America stating the situation but the bank refused to give me an Affidavit. They stated that they could only provide me with a denial letter for the claim. I even tried to speak to a Bank of America Branch manager in my local branch but the representatives told me there was nothing they could do to help me and that only the Fraud Claims department could handle my claim. The bank is refusing to give me an affidavit which is necessary for me to file a police report and go forth with any police investigations. 

I have exhausted all options now. I did not conduct this transaction. I did not use my device to make these transactions. I was not sent any verification emails or text messages to authorize such a transaction from my savings account. I do not have any accounts with XXXX or XXXX XXXX. Bank of America is refusing to reopen my claim even though they are responsible for protecting me and my accounts from fraudulent activity. Bank of America did not even look into who these accounts belong to and has simply disregarded my concerns.

I was also told, ( by an attorney ), that because the bike was in the posession of the recovery company at the time of the hurricane, their insurance company would have to settle with Harley Davidson. Not long after I received a letter stating it was charged off as bad debt, affected by natural disaster. Now 3 years later, I just received a collection notice for {$8500.00}. Is Harley Davidson entitled to be paid twice? Am I still liable for the loss even though the damage occured elsewhere?

Consumer complaint narrative:
On XX/XX/2019, at about XXXX XXXX my joint savings account with my son, was fraudulently charged with wired to a XXXX XXXX of {$5000.00}. I first knew about it when I got an alert on my phone stating that I added XXXX XXXX to my account with and email of XXXX. As I was about call the Bank I got a call from someone Stating that they are calling to report that someone is at ATM is withdrawing {$500.00} from my account and will stop the transaction when they sent me an alert code to my phone. He first verified the account by asking me the recent transactions on the phone which I confirmed, then he asked me the alert code that was sent via text alert and gave it to him thinking that he was an actual Wells Fargo Representative because he verified all the information first on my account. He stated that he will stop the ATM transaction of {$500.00} and will receive a new ATM card on the mail. I ask him hid name of which he stated XXXX XXXX. After the call ended I immediately called the Bank with a 2 minutes spam to find out about the fraud with more detail. They immediately told me that the it was a fraudster who called and that my account was hacked and {$5000.00} was taken from my account. It tool about 10 minutes before they were able to transfer me to the Online Banking Dept. as I was on hold for a long time. When I finally got to an Online Banking Rep they said the will shut down my user name and passcode to create a new one. It took about another 15 to 20 minutes again before I was given the ok to create a new online Banking username and password. They then issued me a claim number number and said it will take 10 business days to process. 
On XX/XX/2019, I got a call from a Wells Fargo Rep stating that my claim is denied and wont be able to issue my {$5000.00} that was fraudulently taken out of my savings account. I was devastated as they said since I gave the alert code to an unknowing fraudster they wont issue the {$5000.00} back to my account. 

Please note that the account who received the {$5000.00} is a Wells Fargo long customer as well with a home based business as the representative told me that the account that the money was wired to. Somehow this sounds fishy. Not certain if its an inside job and why they could not recall the money as I immediately called Wells Fargo when the fraudulent activity was taking place. They first told me it was a XXXX transaction on the day of but then the next day I also saw a {$30.00} charge on the account for wire transfer fees. While on the phone on hold with Wells Fargo, I logged into my online banking and notice the email that was added of which I deleted so I and guessing the fraudster tried and succeed to wire transfer directly. 
I filed a police report and kept calling Wells Fargo and still states they wont issue the money. Please help me. I am in distress as this money was my for my son 's housing when he move to the XXXX XXXX next month. He just graduated college and worried he wont be able to move since he is out {$5000.00} he worked hard for doing an internship.

Issue: Problem with a credit reporting company's investigation into an existing problem
Sub-issue: Problem with personal statement of dispute
Consumer complaint narrative:
At the bottom is a copy of the certified letter I sent Nissan Motor Corporation. After multiple calls and letters, they refuse to work with me. I feel this is very unfair and does not reflect my excellent payment record. I am a cosigner on the total loss car and the new car. They sure didn't have a problem financing a new car for my daughter with me as a cosigner due to our repayment record. They did not even run a credit check because we were told there was no need due to our repayment record with the wrecked car, but they refuse to remove a late payment that I was unaware should have even been made. The car was a total loss. Insurance and gap should have covered the loan amount. We purchased another vehicle. Payment by insurance was still being negotiated along with canceled warranties. They applied those to the principal that left XX/XX/XXXX note unpaid. This was also the month we purchased the new car also through Nissan motor finance. I, the cosigner, was never notified of a balance or missed payment. Once I called to confirm gap payment, they informed me of XX/XX/XXXX missed payment. ( Again, I called them, they never called me. ) I immediately paid two installments which brought the car up to date and have continued to pay monthly while negotiating with insurance and gap. I have begged and pleaded due to circumstances for Nissan to remove the late payment remark they reported in XX/XX/XXXX, but they refuse. I do not understand. This will be on my record for seven years. That is not fair when before this, I had a 100 percent repayment record. 
Copy of Letter Second request. The first request mailed. I am begging for help on this issue. Please take the time to read. Thank you. 

XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Account Number : XXXX XX/XX/XXXX To Whom It May Concern : Thank you for taking the time to read this letter, and I hope your day is going well. Im writing because I noticed that my most recent credit report contains a late payment reported on XX/XX/XXXX for an account that I am a cosigner on ( the XXXX XXXX XXXX acct # xxxxxxxxxxxxx. ) I want you to know that I understand my financial obligations, and if it werent for my daughter being involved in an accident that left her car a total loss, this would not have happened. Please review our payment history. We also financed another vehicle through Nissan based on our excellent credit. Acct # xxxxxxxxxxxx in XX/XX/XXXX. I thought that State farm and gap paid off the XXXX. I wasn't aware there was a balance on this account and I ( the cosigner ) was not notified of a missing payment or balance due. I have an excellent repayment record. I haven't had a late payment in over 8 years and it isn't fair that this will be on my record for 7 years as it does not reflect my repayment record accurately. I made a mistake in falling behind due to these circumstances but since then, the total loss account is up to date with no late or missed payment. I take responsibility but in 35 years of owning vehicles, I have never had this happen. I will set up auto payments or pay the loan off if necessary, to approve the removal of late payment. 

I am in the process of a construction loan and mortgage conversion and its come to my attention that the missed payment on my record has hurt my ability to qualify. My score in XX/XX/XXXX was a xxx. This late payment devastated my score and I truly believe that it doesnt reflect my creditworthiness and commitment to repaying my debts. It would help me immensely if you could give me a second chance and make a goodwill adjustment to remove the late payment posted on XX/XX/XXXX for XX/XX/XXXX payment. As you can see this is when we purchased the XXXX XXXXs and I was unaware of any balance or payment due on the XXXX. 

Thank you for your consideration and I hope youll approve my request. 

Best regards, xxxxxx xxxxxxxxx xxxxxxxxxxx

Consumer complaint narrative: On XX/XX/2019 I called to check if Citizens One had received the check to cancel Gap Insurance on my car. The representative told me no. On another day a female representative in the finance office put me on hold and got back on the phone with another answer of no. On another day one female in the finance department said if the back room couldnt find a customer for the check they would throw it away. I dealt with all the comments of not being able to find the check until the XXXX of XXXX. I called and asked XXXX if they could write me a check for the cancellation of the Gap Insurance and I would pay off the loan of my car and they did. I called Citizens or Citizens One as the name changed each time I called for the payoff. The department gave me the payoff of {$3200.00}. I decided to go to my bank, XXXX XXXX  and send a wire transfer because I had enough of a so called lost check. The banker, XXXX, helped me on XX/XX/2019 to send the wire transfer but had a question if the bank was Citizens or Citizens One and asked if I would give him permission to speak with them. I put my phone on speaker and my wire transfer was sent to Citizens Bank. The banker and I were on speaker when the payoff dropped  to {$3000.00}. I am worried this bank will not send my title to me because of everything I have been through. Their acct number is XXXX, aba number XXXX. My loan account number is XXXX. The last 4 of my ss is XXXX. My name is XXXX XXXX. My address is XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX, Texas XXXX. Their address is Citizens One, XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX, RI XXXX. They have another address of Citizens One, Consumer Loan Servicing, XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX, RI XXXX XXXX. I was never late on my car payment and always had insurance on it. I want to be sure I receive my title as the bank said they send titles to Texas electronically and I will need to go to the DMV in a week to pick it up. It was an unpleasant and unnecessary experience. I want my title and be done with this bank.

On XX/XX/2019 I became aware that I no longer had access to my USAA Savings account, which contains nearly all of my life savings outside of my XXXX, XXXX, and the nominal amount in my checking account. This was highly concerning and put me in a good deal of duress. 

When I called the customer service line, at first they could not locate my account at all. After a period of time, I was informed that my savings account was a custodian account, technically a UTMA account created when I was a child, and due to a recent manual update, I no longer had the ability to view the account or make any actions related to this account. They informed me that this change occurs at the age of XXXX ; I am now XXXX XXXX XXXX and have had access to the account until XX/XX/2019. I received no notice in advance of this change, nor did my father, who they say is the custodian of the account and today still has control of the account. My understanding, after some research, is that I should have had full access to this account when I turned XXXX. 

I was made aware of an internal memo related to this issue. I asked for a copy of this memo or any other written document related to this change in policy, and I was informed that they can not provide anything in writing. I asked for a copy of the recording of the conversation and they were unable to provide it. I received a call from USAA tonight, XX/XX/2019, informing me of the same. 

This episode is very concerning to me. I contacted my father and he has transferred the funds to me in full, but I am not certain he had any obligation to do so, and I am worried that there are other XXXX-year-olds out there who have had their life 's savings taken from them without recourse. I do not understand how USAA could have concluded that an account I should have had sole control over when I turned XXXX was given to my father.

Consumer complaint narrative: I was XXXX and someone got a car loan in my name from XXXX XXXX. I just noticed it not to long ag because I was trying to get a loan. It happened in XXXX of 2015. The amount of the loan was about {$23000.00}

XXXX manager submitted incorrect income information in credit application to multiple banks. Due to this error, auto loans were denied and left me with limited choices to choose for the loan. 

Even though the deal was finalized and completed, credit inquiries with dates after the transaction was done have shown up in my credit report when I did not need a loan anymore.

Problem with Citibank , N.A . 
In XX/XX/2019 I opened three savings accounts via an online application from their solicitation advertising an interest rate of 2.33 %. 

I funded the accounts using the Citibank process for account to account transfers from my credit union account in XXXX, NM by following the instructions from Citibank. The transfer of funds went well. 
On my first bank statement I received in XX/XX/XXXX I noticed Citibank was withholding for federal taxes with the information on my statement saying, " Federal Withholding Tax Uncertified ''. 

I called Citibank inXX/XX/2019 and inquired about the withholding and was informed I need to submit a W-9 and they directed me to the IRS website to obtain the form. I asked how I could submit the form and was told to fax it in. I followed the directions and submitted the form via the fax number they provided. 

XXXX weeks later, I called Citibank and asked if the form was received. I was told by the Citibank representative the forms could not be faxed in and had to be mailed! I followed these contradictory instructions and mailed in the form to the address I was provided in early XX/XX/2019. I was told to wait three weeks for processing. 

On XX/XX/XXXX I called Citibank, and after a long wait on hold time, and after explaining the problem ( again ) I was transferred to their servicing department. The message was the department was closed and I should leave a message and they would respond the next business day. I left detailed information about my name, SSN, account numbers and the reason for my call. I left a daytime phone number and repeated the number, including area code three different times for clarity. No one ever called me back or took care of the issue of my interest being withheld. 

In early XXXX I received my bank statement and noticed interest was still being withheld for taxes, telling me they have not processed either of the forms I submitted. On XX/XX/XXXX I called Citibank and spoke with a representative and told them my story ( again ) and was told I need to talk with a supervisor. They placed me on hold and forgot about me. After 45 minutes of long suffering, I hung up the phone. 

On XX/XX/XXXX I called Citibank again and after entering all the information about my account on the phone and waiting through the phone menus, the message came on they are too busy to talk to me and told me to call back in two hours then they hung up on me. 

On XX/XX/XXXX, I looked online and all three of my accounts are having interest withheld even through I submitted W-9 two different times according to their instructions.
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response

Sub-issue: Confusing or misleading advertising or marketing
Consumer complaint narrative:
My daughter and son-in-law wanted to purchase a more recent model year vehicle since the vehicle they were in was old and unreliable/unsafe for their new baby. They attended car dealer Larry H. Miller 's Used Car tent sale on XX/XX/2019 for XXXX XXXX, at the XXXX expo center. They found a vehicle that they liked but due to having no credit score ( no debt or credit history ) they needed a co-signer. I drove to the tent sale on XX/XX/2019 to co-sign the loan with XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. It was hot and stuffy and very busy with long lines of people waiting to close on their loans. This made Mr. XXXX hurry to rush along the paperwork signing. At no time while we were signing documents did the Finance Manager, XXXX ( XXXX ) XXXX, disclose that due to this being an indirect loan that I would be the primary lendee, and not my daughter and son-in-law, ( XXXX and XXXX XXXX ). After the paperwork was finalized Mr. XXXX told us he would send the final loan documents via email. As of XX/XX/2019 we have not received the final loan documents. 

When the loan was originated with XXXX it showed up on my account, but not on my daughter and son-in-laws account. When the dealership was called to inquire why XXXX XXXX and XXXX did not have access to this loan on their XXXX account we were told that LHM Dealership submitted the paperwork correctly and the fault was on XXXX. When I spoke with Ms. XXXX XXXX, Indirect Lending Manager for XXXX, she explained that XXXX has a rule that the person with the credit score and credit history that signs for the loan is the primary. According to Ms. XXXX the only way to have the loan show on my daughter and son in law 's account is for them to be the primary loan holder. The only way this is possible, per Ms. XXXX, is to go to an XXXX branch and apply for a direct loan. 

Due to this misrepresentation and failure to disclose this fact by Mr. XXXX at LHM Auto Finance,  My daughter and son in law must now come back to Utah from Idaho to re-apply for a car loan and we must all re-sign paperwork, and my credit will be pulled yet again ... If the difference between indirect and direct loans had been disclosed at the time of purchase we would have chosen to go to an XXXX   branch to secure a direct loan. 

I called Mr. XXXX and he claimed that he had told us that I was the primary. Funny how 3 adults signing paperwork all heard differently. When I sat down with Mr. XXXX, I said, " I am here to co-sign on a car loan ''. He never batted an eye or stated anything contrary to that. 

I called LHM and spoke to the General Sales Manager, Mr. XXXX XXXX. He told me the reason I was the primary on the loan was because I was the one with the credit score and if I wasn't the primary, my daughter and son in law would pay a higher loan rate. Ms. XXXX contradicted that statement. Mr. XXXX also said he didn't know what I wanted him to do about it. 

I am not sure if this is a TILA violation but LHM Finance Manager XXXX ( XXXX ) XXXX failed to disclose the difference between an indirect and direct loan, so we did not have all of the information to make an educated and informed decision. Their handling of this situation has been unprofessional, lacked any customer service and misrepresented the terms and type of loan we believed we signed. I have attached a copy on an email I sent to Mr. XXXX and Mr. XXXX at Larry H. Miller Auto.
Company: Larry H. Miller Group of Companies

To Whom it may concern, I am writing regarding my ongoing dispute with the company Credit Acceptance Corp. My Credit Acceptance account number is XXXX. I purchased a car ( a XXXX XXXX XXXX ) on XX/XX/XXXX from XXXX   XXXX XXXX, the price of the car was {$6000.00} ( attachment 1 ). I put {$2000.00} down, as the lender Credit Acceptance dictated. The dealership added a lender fee of {$450.00}, making the amount to be financed {$4500.00}. 
As the salesman was going over the sales contract with me ( attachment 2 ), he advised me that if I kept the loan for the full 48 months, I would pay a total amount of {$6800.00} and that it would be in my best interest to pay off this loan as soon as possible. 
On XXXX XXXX at XXXX, I called Credit Acceptance to obtain a payoff balance and was advised that amount was approximately {$6500.00}. I immediately advised the company that amount could not be correct. The company representative became belligerent and condescending. I advised the rep that I would like to file a dispute. The representative told me that he submitted my dispute and forwarded it to the complaint resolution department and that they would call me at a later date. 
I immediately called the auto dealership and spoke with the manager, XXXX. XXXX advised me that my figures were correct on the sale price of the car, and emailed me proof the cost ( attachment 1 ). XXXX was not able to provide a reason why the salesman entered the incorrect amount in the cash price box on the agreement that I did sign. XXXX also went to her accounting department and provided me with a copy of the payment from Credit Acceptance to XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX  in the amount of {$4500.00} ( attachment 3 ). In addition, XXXX phoned Credited Acceptance to try to fix this error, but was told that I would be responsible for the amount entered into the cash price box of the contract AND further interest and fees on that amount. 
With an already excessively high interest rate of 28 %, paying that rate on an additional and incorrect {$4000.00} is obscene, abusive and predatory. I have paid my monthly payments on time, every month without postponing a single payment. See attached payment history ( attachment 4 ) which includes additional interest charged to me. 
On XX/XX/XXXX, I received a phone call from XXXX in the conflict resolution department of Credit Acceptance. During this 8 minute and 55 second call, she advised me to send in what documentation that I had to prove my dispute. I emailed my documents to her that evening and she returned my call the next day ( this call lasting 1 hour and 13 minutes ). XXXX said that based on the information that I submitted, there was a discrepancy but that they would not be making any changes to my account and the dispute was closed. During this call, I also spoke with supervisor XXXX, who also disregarded all of the documents that I submitted and advised that there would be no changes to my account. 
I have sent many emails and talked with XXXX  several times since then. I have not received a single written or email reply from this company. When I speak with XXXX on the phone, she hangs up and ends the conversation before all of my questions are answered. I have sent several email requests for the company to perform a real and actual investigation to no avail. I have asked for a written ( at least ) summary of their investigation and have been refused. 
During my phone calls with XXXX, I have been given deflective and deceptive answers to questions. For example, when I asked XXXX how many payments that I have made on my account, her answer was about 17, or maybe 20 to 25. When I asked her to add up the funds that I have sent in on all of my payments combined, her answer was well, if you financed {$8500.00} and your balance is now {$6500.00}, then you have paid in about {$2000.00}. When XXXX asked me if I had proof of what the car was selling for, I said yes, I have already sent this to you. Her reply was that is not a Credit acceptance contract, and then she promptly moved to another topic completely disregarding my answer AND the proof that she requested. 
I have made 17 payments for a total of {$4300.00} and been charged {$2300.00} in interest. All based on an incorrect sales price. I need to have my account recalculated with the correct sales price in place, and a financed amount of {$4500.00}. 
If I had a loan for {$4500.00} with an interest rate of 28 % and total payments of {$260.00} per month, the total payoff over the length of the loan should be {$5800.00}. However, for a loan on the amount of {$6800.00} the total payments for the life of the loan would be {$11000.00}. Credit Acceptance only paid {$4500.00} to the dealer for the car ( see attachment 3 ). They are requesting that I pay approximately {$5500.00} in invalid fees. 
All that I am asking for is what is fair, just and right. I would like an accurate balance on my account, so that I may pay off the car. I am not asking for a reduction in their abusive interest rate, nor even any sort of refund at this time, if my payments have over paid what I in actuality owe on this car. If, however, Credit Acceptance attempts to drag this dispute out and there is a large over payment on my part, I will ask to recoup that loss, with an interest rate of 28 %.

If Credit Acceptance insists that I pay on a loan of {$6800.00} with an interest rate of 28 %, and they only paid {$4500.00} to Incredible Auto, then I need them to make a payment to me in the amount of {$2300.00} plus 28 % interest for 16 months. This payment would insure that they would not be guilty of fraud. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response

Went in to purchase a vehicle. Spent several hours negotiating a price we discussed before hand. Settled it's with the dealer and went on to sign the deal. He switched the number around and added the same item back on to the document but spelled out differently we didnt catch it at the time but apparently it's a known scam. XXXX XXXX was falsifying items unbeknownst to us. He admitted to this in the office after confronted about items not matching up and not giving us all the forms after the purchase. After being pulled all the way to the other side of the lot for financing and being told our agreed upon payment method XXXX XXXX XXXX would not be accepted one of us left to rush home for a check book. This division added to the confusion they would use to not turn over any receipts or documents besides the e-signature thing mixed in with the swapped buy order. Once we returned back he had none of the items and made excuses and delayed handing them over until general service XXXX intervened. He then presented a document he said was for the vehicle a document he said was from the time of signing. The document listed a different vehicle but had same model number at a lower price.. XXXX XXXX XXXX said it didnt exist and was not on the list of vehicles in the system he had showed us. Upon further review we found that the XXXX VA XXXX XX/XX/14 was digitally signed for accepting a loan. We were in the office physically and were signing with a pen. The signature was so foreign to us that we initially thought it was forged. Mentioned to this to XXXX XXXX and he never mentioned it was an e signature. He only stated no one had forged it. However someone else signed a e signature on our behalf without discussing this with us. Further discussion revealed that the staff keep the sales documents in an EDITABLE document. XXXX demonstrated this by deleting the lines in a document, showing he could. He then tried to take it back by saying only that one page was editable. But it was in same pdf so the entire documents integrity is in in question. So happens the doc in question they had on file was empty while the one we signed was not ( we took a picture of it ). We were presented multiple buy orders with differing numbers signed as proof we agreed to one price. When questioned about this he blamed the computers. It didnt seem to matter that they had so many with different versions of the price of the vehicle. Salesman was engaged in fraudullent manipulating documents telling stories that didnt add up to any of the other employees not even the XXXX XXXX XXXX. We requested to return the vehicle as it was obvious they were not being genuine. They said no, as if counting on the doctored up contracts to protect them. While he expressed confusion as well the XXXX XXXX didnt really care about what had been done.

Consumer complaint narrative: On XXXX XXXX, 2019 the car in question ( XXXX XXXX ) was reposed from a location in XXXX, Ca, by way of a tracking device ( installed in the car ). Sub-issue: Didn't receive terms that were advertised
Consumer complaint narrative: On XX/XX/2019 I went to Huntington Bank in XXXX to open up account that would pay {$200.00} if you made a deposit of {$10000.00} and maintained for 60 days. The lady opening account open the account that I did not ask for. She closed that account and open the account that will pay me the {$200.00} but forgot to put in the promotional code XXXX. The promotion stated {$10000.00} cumulative deposits have to be done within 60 days I deposit {$25000.00}. I've talked to a XXXX XXXX on several occasions and he told me someone is investigating. This was a problem created by the bank but the bank will not correct the problem.

My complaint concerns TD Bank. I have been a customer in the XXXX area since XXXX, with checking, savings and credit card products. In XXXX of XXXX, I went in to my branch to update my Savings account to one with the best interest rate ( from their 'High Yield Savings Account ' to their 'TD Select Savings Account ' ). The savings account I chose had tiered interest rates based on the account balance, and a 'rate bump ' ( a higher band of interest rates at every tier for having additional linked accounts, like their Visa credit card ). I fulfilled all the requirements for their best interest rate, and left satisfied with the product I had signed up for. Since XXXX of XXXX, I have periodically monitored the interest rates by going to the TD Bank web site, and was pleased to see that they remained reasonably competitive. However, when I recently did the math based on interest credited to my account, I discovered that I was getting far less than the posted rate. This led to numerous phone calls and a trip to my local branch to try and get the issue addressed. No one at the bank or on the phone was able to accurately explain or resolve my problem, but I managed to piece together the following scenario ... 

In XXXX of XXXX, mere weeks after I opened my 'TD Select Savings Account ', they grandfathered ( retired ) this account  product and did not notify me. It was 'replaced ' with a product called the 'TD Preferred Savings Account ' with essentially identical features to the 'TD Select Savings Account ' ( including the tiered interest rates and rate bump features ). To my best understanding, the only thing that changed for this product is the name. When TD grandfathered my 'TD Select Savings Account ', they essentially froze the interest rate at the XX/XX/XXXX level, but the 'TD Preferred Savings ' rates ( advertised prominently on their website ) rose steadily as competition in the savings account market increased over the past couple years. Even worse, it is impossible to find information on the current rates and tiers for my 'TD Select Savings Account ' without making a special request - so this is  clearly an active suppression of information. I can not view this as anything other than a 'bait and switch ' scheme. Without telling their customers, they changed their product used to advertise their savings account rates and replaced it with something identical in all but name, but with lower interest rates. Not even their customer service representatives were able to easily spot the difference! In my case, this was mere weeks after I opened the account. Given that I keep all my emergency funds in this savings account, it has resulted in a significant loss of interest income over the past 2 years. I have talked to the store manager at my local branch, and multiple banking representatives at the branch and through their 24/7 phone support, and no one is willing to acknowledge wrongdoing or correct the issue in any way.

Sub-issue: Didn't receive terms that were advertised
Consumer complaint narrative: I opened Chase Saving account online in XX/XX/XXXX with the promotion of {$200.00} bonus for depositing a total of {$15000.00} or more in new money within 20 business days, and maintaining a {$15000.00} balance for 90 days ( promotion link : https : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ) by clicking on the " open account '', which automatically load the offer code in the saving account application. The bonus should be deposited to my saving account within 10 business days of meeting the terms and conditions. I met all the terms and condition but still haven't received the bonus by XX/XX/XXXX. I contacted Chase via online message, but was told there is no promotion code ever on the account and since the account has been opened for more than 21 days they would not be able to add the code now.

Sub-issue: Funds not handled or disbursed as instructed
Consumer complaint narrative:
Hello - In XXXX of this year I opened a Checking and Savings Account with JP Morgan Chase ( Chase ) under a {$600.00} promotion offer. The terms of the offer clearly stated the following : " Checking offer is not available to existing Chase checking customers. Savings offer is not available to existing Chase savings customers. Both offers are not available to those whose accounts have been closed within 90 days or closed with a negative balance. '' I did not have existing accounts and I did not close accounts within the 90 days. Hence I went ahead opened the accounts, transferred {$15000.00} in my savings account, established direct deposit in my checking account and met all the terms of the promotion. It has now been several months since I have met all the terms of the promotion. However Chase has not credited the {$600.00} promotion credit to my account. After several secure messages, and calls to the Customer Service Department they are telling me that my accounts are ineligible for the {$600.00} promotion credit because of an " internal policy '' at the bank indicating that promotion credit can be obtained only once every two years.

However such " internal policy '' requirement was not disclosed to me when the Bank cheated me and took my hard earned {$15000.00} funds from me. Attached are the terms and condition of the promo code with all the published eligibility requirements and you will see for yourself that the Bank has not disclosed this ficticious " internal policy '' before accepting funds from a customer. On the contrary the Bank has knowlingly and deliberately lied to customers indicating they will be eligible for the bonus provided they did not close accounts in the past 90 days.

To say one thing in writing and openly to defraud a customer of their money and then turnaround and present another set of eligibility requirements based on undisclosed and fictitious " internal policies '' is out right cheating, daylight robbery, unethical, illegal, immoral and utterly shameful and shameless behavior!

Towards the end of XX/XX/2019, I had needed funds to prepare for Hurricane Dorian.  The hurricane actually hit our city which my home and other relatives in the area. The funds were necessary for the preparation, cleanup and repair of damages experienced during this storm. This was the main reason as to why I could not maintain the {$20000.00} balance requirement of this savings product. 

I had pleaded with TD Bank to provide some leniency in their " monthly maintenance fees '' that were applied to my TD Bank Select Savings Rate Bump account for XX/XX/XXXX and XX/XX/2019. After four phone conversations, six in person interactions and a discussion with their social media relations team, I had enough and decided that their response was not only inadequate, but truly spiteful. Despite being a TD Bank customer for some time and had a sizeable amount of funds in the account in that time, there was not an ounce of sincerity or kindness in their actions towards me. 

Time after time again, the bank refused to waive the fees and actually ridiculed my decision to take out these funds to repair damage caused by the hurricane. Two fees are in question with this complaint : 1. XX/XX/2019 : a fee of " {$14.00} '' described as a " Maintenance Fee ''. 
2. XX/XX/2019 : a fee of " {$14.00} '' described as a " Maintenance Fee. '' The bank provided no timely guidance to me as ( 1 ) how to switch over to a different product that would have lower minimum balance requirements ; ( 2 ) provide any guidance for how to refund or waive these " maintenance fees '' and ( 3 ) failed to assist with resolving my concerns, despite numerous attempts of reaching out to them.

Hi, I '' ve tried to close my savings account 2 times now and each time more fees are added on after the representative at Citibank confirmed the account was submitted for closure after removing the fees. 

The first time, the representative confirmed that since there was a XXXX balance the account will be closed with no issues and " closed '' the Citibank savings account.

The second time, I received a letter stating I owed a balance on the account due to a monthly maintenance fee being charged AFTER the account was closed.

The CSR explained that an interest of XXXX posted to the account which stopped the account closure. She then XXXX the balance and submitted a request for a XXXX cent refund. She assured me the account will now be properly closed.

Less than 2 weeks later, I receive a letter for an overdue balance on the savings account for XXXX. Obviously this account IS NOT CLOSED STILL. 

This is ridiculous as each call requires me to be put on hold for hours to resolve this! Only to find out the account was not closed and more fees are being charged!

opinion letter Cass from LeFevre .FDCPA Section 805 ( c ) FDCPA Section 805 ( a ) ( 1 ). FDCPA Section 805 ( a ) ( 3 ). FDCPA Section 805 ( b ), 806, 807, 811 ( a ) ( 2 ). FCRA Section 623. each Fine minimum {$1000.00} per violation as per FDCPA Laws.

I called them on XX/XX/2019 and an agent told me to pay {$150.00} to stop repossession, so I did that day. The following week of XX/XX/2019 I made a payment of {$650.00} towards the past due balance. Then another payment of {$420.00}, in which they told me I was caught up on my payments. Then on XX/XX/2019, made a payment of {$400.00} to try to keep my account current. The only payments I've missed were XXXX and XX/XX/2019. And were making partial payments due to employment issues. Now they're saying that I'm {$2000.00} behind once again! I've written to the FTC and to corporate about this problem. Lately they've been threatening to repossess the vehicle and harassing me through email for monies so called owed. On XX/XX/XXXX, my son asked me to co-sign for an RV.  I agreed to co-sign and completed an on-line application going to XX/XX/XXXX.  XX/XX/XXXX Finance Manager was going to review my online credit application and work to get my son and I approved.I submitted my online application to reflect that I am working as an XX/XX/XXXX making only $XXXX per month, $XXXX per year.  I was unsure how I would aid in financing as a co-signer with limited income, but did it anyway to support my son.I learned from my son that we were approved.  I was quite surprised, but thankful to support him.  On XX/XX/XXXX, I traveled to XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX located in XXXX XXXX, FL.  I learned late in the day that the co-sign was not possible that I would be the sole borrower.  I went into total shock as I was told by my son that it was a co-sign.  The RV Finance Manager had never spoken to me, texted me, arranged a conference call or emailed me to inform of this change.  I only make $XXXX a year and could not understand how I was approved for a loan that is over $XXXX per month.  I was in a mental state of XXXX and shock and did not make logical sense.  The finance manager did not go over the paper work, but had me sign in my distress.  When I returned home to XXXX, GA, I received a copy of the contract to learn that my loan had been approved with false income.  The online application that I submitted was confirmed by the VP of XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX and proof of my submission sent to me via email.  I have it attached to the complaint.  XXXX stated he would work with the bank to reverse the loan and we would work to return the RV, obtain back the $XXXX downpayment and he was holding my son's trade in XXXX XXXX   van with the wholesaler he had sold it to.  After XXXX  worked with Bank of the West to attempt to undo the loan , they stated that they would not reverse.  I continued to work with XXXX  with no resolution.I am a victim of a form of identity fraud, lending fraud and now have a XXXX debt that should have never been approved by the bank.  I was intentionally blindsided by the XXXX XXXX XXXX  They never briefed me on anything and only worked with my son and his ex-wife.  The bank should have audited my online application and confirmed the income to be valid.  Someone changed my gross income of $XXXX per month to be $XXXX net income per month.  I am unsure who was responsible for this, but XXXX XXXX XXXX did confirm that they terminated the Finance Manager for the wrong doings in this sales transaction.
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response

Consumer complaint narrative: I recently purchased s car from XXXX XXXX and the car loan was approved through Global Lending Service. However, contacting GLS is extremely difficult and results in inaccurate, incomplete and none resolved issues. I initially revived a call from GLS regarding a welcome call from XXXX. However, I was unable to talk for 7-10 minutes and asked for a return call but was denied a number to call them back on. XXXX stated that I needed to just dial the number that showed up on my call id. Unfortunately, unknown caller was the message received instead of an actual number. The welcome call was finally completed via XXXX a funding manager but the next issue was verifying my insurance. I provided all the information to XXXX but somehow it was not uploaded or documented as such but getting back in touch with XXXX to resolve the issue was not possible. Despite several calls and attempts I never received a return call from anyone at GLS. The problem is now making payments. The car payment is due on the XXXX ( today ) or XXXX ( tomorrow ) of the month and I have no information on how to make a payment. I called again today and was simply told by XXXX that, its my responsibility to make a payment and do what I need to do to get the information. She informed me that the application was completed at the end of XXXX ( no date was given ) which is maybe the reason why I havent received the welcome package because that takes 7-10 days after its completed. She also stated that the person that did my welcome call should have explained all of this to me. However, when I spoke to XXXX, I was told that the information would be mailed out but that was almost a month ago and I havent been able to reach him since. So please assist in obtaining the needed information to actually make payments and gathering the terms of the loan and conditions. I purchased the car at the end of XXXX and have now been trying for almost 2 months to obtain information from GLS with no resolution. Instead I get attitude from associates and the nasty snare of its my responsibility to do what I need to do but there is only so much that can be done if you dont get a returned call, dont get the information in the mail, dont know the terms of the loan and havent been provided accurate information to agree and or ask questions.
The company is taking 3/4 of of my payments every month and paying of the interest first

I apologize in advance because this complaint is years in the making. I will do my best to give you as much detail as possible but please understand that because this has been going on for 4 1/2 years I can't give you specific dates on everything. 

Let me start out by saying I am a XXXX military veteran. Part of my XXXX is XXXX problems. I don't say this to garner sympathy, but to inform you that I did serve my country proudly and am hurt by how I'm being treated by my credit union who I thought was supposed to help me. Many years ago while I was still on XXXX XXXX, I bought a XXXX  XXXX XXXX XXXX. I bought it from a dealer named XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX on XX/XX/XXXX. Everything went well because I already was approved for a loan through Navy Federal Credit Union. Everything went well until I went to the XXXX DMV in NY the next day to try and register the vehicle. The DMV told me they couldn't register the vehicle under my name because I didn't have a title. After I found out about this, I called Navy Federal to find out if they had the tile so I can register the vehicle under my name. Navy Federal told me they didn't. I then tried calling the dealer I bought the car from but I never once received an answer. Because I was XXXX XXXX, I was not able to follow up on this for about a week but once I did that's when things hit the fan. 

When I get my next off-duty days, I go back to the dealer I bought the vehicle from. The dealer was nowhere to be found. I mean the entire dealership and not just the salesman. The entire lot was empty and it looked like a ghost town. At this point I am stressing out and I am wondering what's going on. I call Navy Federal and I ask them if they ever received the title for this vehicle to which they told me no. Now I have a vehicle that is not under my name, and that I won't be able to drive because the license plate is temporary. I couldn't even insure the vehicle. I then head to the XXXX XXXX Police Department to begin an investigation and truth be told no one wants to help me out. I seemed like a nuisance to them and nothing ever really got done. Because I was getting nowhere, I called Navy Federal Credit Union and ask what can I do to have this loan undone because I now had a vehicle that I could n't drive, couldn't register under my name, and whose title was nowhere to be found. In their own words they essentially tell me, too bad so sad. Over the next few weeks I talk to Navy Federal at least 2 more times wondering how I can get out of this loan but they didn't help me at all and told me I'm going to have to pay for the loan no matter what because they lent me the money. 

From that point I stopped driving the vehicle because it wasn't registered to me and I couldn't register it without the title. Navy Federal never obtained the title so I was not going to drive a vehicle that was not mine and had no tags. Furthermore, if I got into an accident, I didn't want to be liable for damages since I couldn't even insure the vehicle. Because of this, the vehicle was literally parked in the yard at my residence for three years. Throughout all those years I paid on the loan to Navy Federal because I didn't know what to do and Navy Federal never helped me with anything. XXXX came and I was going to be moving to California as I was no longer in the service and wouldn't have a home. I didn't know what to do with the vehicle that I could n't drive so I made a last ditch effort and headed to the XXXX Police Station and see if there was anything more that could be done. Thankfully, the police officer helping me at that station was a good officer. He did a real investigation and found out that the vehicle I purchased was a stolen vehicle. He even found out who the prior owner was. The police called the previous owner and asked if they still wanted the vehicle. The previous owner told them no. Once the police department deemed the vehicle no longer needed to be registered as stolen, they removed the stolen status of the vehicle and made it so I could finally register the vehicle under my name. This was either in XXXX or XXXX of XXXX. I started the process but unfortunately it was too late for me to be able to obtain the tile anymore as my departure for California had arrived. I was forced to leave the vehicle with a friend named XXXX as I could not risk driving it across the country with 3 year old tags, no insurance, and no registration. Keep in mind at this point I have already paid 3 1/2 years for a vehicle that was stolen and has never been legally mine. 

Once I got to California, I eventually ended up getting the title to my vehicle. I start making plans to register the vehicle in my name, insure the vehicle, and pick it up from XXXX. However, the same time I got my registration sent to me by mail, my friend XXXX calls me and tells me my vehicle has been stolen. It feels like it happened the exact same time. I call Navy Federal to tell them what happened but as they told me before many years prior, too bad so sad. You have to pay for this vehicle loan. Even after all this I continued to make payments faithfully until about 2 months ago. Truth be told, I can no longer afford it. 

Because I feel like I've been taken advantage of, and because nobody else would help me, I finally reached a company that had a good reputation from all the reviews I've seen. I told this company about my situation and they were very honest with me in telling me they are unsure if they could help me but that they would attempt to assist me If I chose to enlist them in their aid. They said I would be their guinea pig  since they had handled cases that resembled my problem but not one specifically like it. I agreed since they were the only ones willing to help me and they seemed honest so I decided to let them get involved. Well I thought I had a hard time with Navy Federal but these guys had it worse. 

My representatives by the name of XXXX XXXX XXXX started calling Navy Federal and sending power of attorney by mail. After a month they received no response of any kind by Navy Federal. I go back to XXXX XXXX XXXX office on XX/XX/XXXX and they call Navy Federal in front of me. In that conversation, representatives from navy Federal don't seem like they know what they are doing. They are asking my representative questions like, " what department do you want to send the power of attorney to '' and " what account are you sending the power of attorney for? '' After letting them know he wants Navy Federal as a whole to have the power of attorney on file and not just one department they finally end up giving him a fax number of XXXX. They also give him an address of XXXX power of attorney XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Fl XXXX. My representative re-mails the poa and faxes the poa to them on the XXXX of XXXX. By the XXXX of XXXX, he receives another call from a representative asking him the same question as before, " what department do you want to send this to? '' Please keep in mind that my representative has been trying to forward them power of attorney since XX/XX/XXXX in order to begin discussing the situation to him and he is still receiving these ridiculous questions and I am still waiting for progress to be made. He finally tells the representative that he is surprised a large organization such as Navy Federal is having trouble figuring out what they are supposed to be doing with a power of attorney especially since they have the conversation with him as well as his intentions recorded and noted down. 

By XX/XX/XXXX, I came back to XXXX XXXX XXXX to get another update as to what's going on. We call Navy Federal Credit Union together again and this is when all XXXX broke loose. We were on the phone for over 50 minutes. We were transferred and put on hold numerous times. They were trying to find out if they even had authorization to speak with him. My representative informed them how he had been forwarding power of attorney numerous times and now was starting to understand why he was reached for assistance by me. Finally a Navy Federal employee informed him that they did receive the power of attorney and it was accepted, but that the employee couldn't see it in her system. She was going to reach out to another department to figure out what's going on. When she came back she was asking for more time to " activate '' the Power of Attorney. I was getting visibly upset so my representative pressed on and informed Navy Federal that we needed to speak to someone now or I would file this very complaint I am now filing. He was not going to accept that Navy Federal noted they received POA and accepted POA but that they needed more time because they were having IT issues. After the 25 minute mark, we reached another representative in the collections department. 

Miss XXXX is the representative in the collections department. Once he reached her he began describing the situation from the very beginning. The beginning being me being sold a stolen vehicle from a shady auto dealership. He described the situation of everything that I went through in not being able to register my vehicle because I didn't have the tile and nor did Navy Federal. He described how when I reached out to Navy Federal for help I was basically told I had to pay for the loan no matter what happened. He described how here I am 4 1/2 years later and thousands of dollars poorer for a loan that should have never been allowed to continue. He then begins asking several questions about when the loan originated, when title was received by Navy Federal, and several others. Miss XXXX begins telling him that she doesn't know the answer to most of these but offered to settle the debt and send us to the settlement department. We were then put on hold again. 

When Miss XXXX comes back, she confirms to us that title for this vehicle was not obtained until XX/XX/XXXX! This is 3 1/2 years after the loan originated. My representative asked her straight up " Do you see a problem there? '' Miss XXXX said " I do, I do see a problem there. '' She then said the loan was transferred to a signature loan. My representative then begins asking more questions and Miss XXXX continues to answer several of them with I don't know. She also kept saying on numerous occasions that she doesn't feel like she was very helpful. Finally when the conversation is almost over Miss XXXX turns on her collector mode switch and the conversation begins to turn sour. She asks my rep if I had kept in touch with Navy Federal about the situation. Obviously I did and he tells her as such but then she begins quoting the number of calls I've made to them supposedly. She lists 3 calls I've made since XXXX and then says that's all the calls I've made and not once did I tell them about the stolen vehicle. She then begins to attempt to establish that I never told them this vehicle was stolen but my representative was not having it. He tells her its highly unlikely I've only spoken to them only 3 times since there was communication at the beginning of the loan. Finally she clarifies that I only spoke to collection 3 times. 

My representative then says he understood I only spoke with collections 3 times but that Navy Federal as a whole had received numerous calls from me. Again she said she didn't know anything about that and then began to get really aggressive. She informed my representative that she was going to terminate the call because she didn't feel comfortable that my representative was asking her questions she didn't know the answer to. She then began raising her voice and interjecting and speaking over my representative. Finally my representative terminated the call himself as she was being belligerent and he was not going to get anywhere from that point on. 

I am filing this complaint because I don't know what else to do. I have been paying for a vehicle that I have never been able to claim as my own since the very beginning. This is not an I wrecked my car and don't want to pay for it anymore or my car broke down and its too expensive to fix so I don't want to pay for it anymore type of claim. This is literally an I never owned my car from day 1 and have been paying for the vehicle for 4 1/2 years without being able to use it. This is a my credit union funded a loan and never unwound the loan or got their money back once they found out I couldn't get title or register the vehicle, insure the vehicle, or transfer it under my name with them as the lienholder. This is an I asked my credit union for help and have been met with a cold shoulder and asked to pay a loan when they know I was ripped off from the beginning complaint.
Company public response: Company believes it acted appropriately as authorized by contract or law

Sub-issue: Changes in terms mid-deal or after closing
Consumer complaint narrative:
I traded in my car about a year ago. I test drove a few vehicles and the salesman asked if I can get you into that with a payment around {$300.00}, do we have a deal. I said yes, thats a big if. 
The dealership was unable to come even close to the monthly payment I was comfortable with. I requested to leave and stated I just wanted keep my car several times. The salesman and the finance manager double teamed me for an extremely high pressure sale. Over the course of about 3-4 hours, I finally agreed to a finance plan suggested by the finance manager. It was almost double what I wanted to pay monthly, but he proposed that instead of putting a down payment, that I put that money in a savings account instead. He explained each month, I could take {$XXXX} out of savings to put towards my monthly payment, that way I didnt feel like I was over extending my budget. He promised in one year, I could come back when my credit score was higher and they would get me refinanced. I didnt want any add on policies to the loan, but the finance manager wouldnt stop pushing the auto warranty. He kept doing calculations and asking what if it only increased your monthly payment by $ x? 
I finally agreed to one that was an increase of around $ XXXX/month ( I dont remember the exact amount ). I signed all the paperwork. The vehicle was delivered to me with an empty gas tank and low pressure in all four tires. It was very late and I had spent the entire day at the dealership within food, so I didnt notice until I left the lot. A couple days later, I went to add the vehicle to my auto insurance and was surprised that I couldnt find the name of a lender. In the mean time, I kept getting notifications of hard credit pulls from my credit monitoring account. I called to ask about the lender and was told they hadnt secured financing yet, which was very strange. A few days later, I was asked to come back to sign loan paperwork. At that time, I told them I dont want the extended auto warranty. 
When I arrived to sign papers, I asked if he received my message about deleting the extended warranty. 
He stated that actually a lot had changed and in order to get the financing, the lender was requiring gap insurance and an extended warranty. I was told that the interest rate was XXXX  % higher and in order to make the deal work, they had to lower the sell price of the vehicle. I asked if I could have my car back and was told they didnt have it. 
I felt trapped, as now my only options were to sign the loan papers for this car or walk away with no car. 
I signed the documentation and I have been paying on the vehicle faithfully for a year. I have maintained it, including spending $ XXXX+ on recommenced maintenance when required. All maintenance has been done at the dealership. 
My credit score increased by XXXX points. Ive tried to refinance the vehicle and Im not able to because the loan amount exceeds the value of vehicle by too much. I cant trade in the vehicle either. I dont want the high payments any more and I dont want the vehicle. I never wanted it. I was pressured into buying it and I was pressured to agree to loan terms that I didnt originally agree to. 
I recently learned that its not legal to require a buyer to purchase additional insurance and warranties. I inquired about the legalities if this on a phone call with the lender. The rep stated its their right to protect their investment by requiring certain coverages. I asked him if they knew it was it was illegal to require it and he didnt have much to say. 
I reviewed my purchase contract and it explicitly states no additional coverages are required for the purchase. I wish I had known this at the time. Ive recently requested the dealership cancel both policies. The finance manager emailed me a cancellation form, which I completed and faxed to the number on the form. I emailed to ask for confirmation the fax had been received and processed. No answer, so I emailed again. The reply was that the fax went to a different office and that if I had turned in all the required documentation with the fax, the request would be processed. I immediately reviewed the previous emails and the cancellation form for instructions on additional documentation and there was none. I emailed again to ask what the required documentation was and I received no reply. Ive also made attempts to speak to the general manager about this issue and someone left me a voicemail on behalf of the XXXX. I returned his call a couple times and none of my voicemails have been returned.

Consumer complaint narrative: I was attempting to buy a Kia XXXX at XXXX XXXX XXXX in XXXX XXXX, MD on XX/XX/2019. We had agreed on a price of {$20000.00} with a loan amount of {$18000.00} ( after a {$2000.00} down payment ). My husband and I both filled out the credit application. The dealer contacted us soon after our credit application was filed demanding more paperwork from my husband- pay stubs, proof of employment, questions about his recent immigration status and our marriage. The dealer said they could not confirm his new temporary social security number. We told the dealer that my husband had legally obtained and used his social security number to find employment and obtain a driver 's license. Finally the dealer agreed that they had enough information and were going to go ahead with the loan.
